param.pre: = 0: successful exit < 0: if the i-th argument is a scalar and had an illegal value, then INFO = -i, if the i-th argument is an array and the j-entry had an illegal value, then INFO = -(i*100+j) > 0: the algorithm failed = 1, a split was marked by a positive value in E = 2, current block of Z not diagonalized after 100*N iterations (in inner while loop). On exit Z holds a qd array with the same eigenvalues as the given Z. = 3, termination criterion of outer while loop not met (program created more than N unreduced blocks)

para.pre: To see the relation of Z to the tridiagonal matrix, let L be a unit lower bidiagonal matrix with subdiagonals Z(2,4,6,,..) and let U be an upper bidiagonal matrix with 1's above and diagonal Z(1,3,5,,..). The tridiagonal is L*U or, if you prefer, the symmetric tridiagonal to which it is similar. Note : DLASQ2 defines a logical variable, IEEE, which is true on machines which follow ieee-754 floating-point standard in their handling of infinities and NaNs, and false otherwise. This variable is passed to DLASQ3.
Local Variables: I0:N0 defines a current unreduced segment of Z. The shifts are accumulated in SIGMA. Iteration count is in ITER. Ping-pong is controlled by PP (alternates between 0 and 1).

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes the singular values of a real N-by-N bidiagonal matrix with diagonal D and off-diagonal E.

param.name: n
param.pre: he number of rows and columns in the matrix. N >= 0.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (N) n entry, D contains the diagonal elements of the bidiagonal matrix whose SVD is desired. On normal exit, D contains the singular values in decreasing order.

param.name: e
param.pre: Dimension (N) n entry, elements E(1:N-1) contain the off-diagonal elements of the bidiagonal matrix whose SVD is desired. On exit, E is overwritten.

param.name: work
param.pre: Dimension (4*N)

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: the algorithm failed = 1, a split was marked by a positive value in E = 2, current block of Z not diagonalized after 100*N iterations (in inner while loop) On exit D and E represent a matrix with the same singular values which the calling subroutine could use to finish the computation, or even feed back into DLASQ1 = 3, termination criterion of outer while loop not met (program created more than N unreduced blocks)

para.pre: The singular values are computed to high relative accuracy, in the absence of denormalization, underflow and overflow. The algorithm was first presented in "Accurate singular values and differential qd algorithms" by K. V. Fernando and B. N. Parlett, Numer. Math., Vol-67, No. 2, pp. 191-230, 1994, and the present implementation is described in "An implementation of the dqds Algorithm (Positive Case)", LAPACK Working Note.

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Applies a sequence of plane rotations to a real matrix A, from either the left or the right.

param.name: side
param.pre: Specifies whether the plane rotation matrix P is applied to A on the left or the right. = 'L': Left, compute A := P*A = 'R': Right, compute A:= A*PT

param.name: pivot
param.pre: Specifies the plane for which P(k) is a plane rotation matrix. = 'V': Variable pivot, the plane (k,k+1) = 'T': Top pivot, the plane (1,k+1) = 'B': Bottom pivot, the plane (k,z)

param.name: direct
param.pre: Specifies whether P is a forward or backward sequence of plane rotations. = 'F': Forward, P = P(z-1)*...*P(2)*P(1) = 'B': Backward, P = P(1)*P(2)*...*P(z-1)

param.name: m
param.pre: The number of rows of the matrix A. If m <= 1, an immediate return is effected.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns of the matrix A. If n <= 1, an immediate return is effected.

param.name: c
param.pre: Dimension (M-1) if SIDE = 'L' (N-1) if SIDE = 'R' The cosines c(k) of the plane rotations.

param.name: s
param.pre: Dimension (M-1) if SIDE = 'L' (N-1) if SIDE = 'R' The sines s(k) of the plane rotations. The 2-by-2 plane rotation part of the matrix P(k), R(k), has the form R(k) = ( c(k) s(k) ) ( -s(k) c(k) ).

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) The M-by-N matrix A. On exit, A is overwritten by P*A if SIDE = 'R' or by A*PT if SIDE = 'L'.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,M).

para.pre: When SIDE = 'L', the transformation takes the form A := P*A and when SIDE = 'R', the transformation takes the form A := A*PT where P is an orthogonal matrix consisting of a sequence of z plane rotations, with z = M when SIDE = 'L' and z = N when SIDE = 'R', and PT is the transpose of P. When DIRECT = 'F' (Forward sequence), then P = P(z-1) * ... * P(2) * P(1) and when DIRECT = 'B' (Backward sequence), then P = P(1) * P(2) * ... * P(z-1) where P(k) is a plane rotation matrix defined by the 2-by-2 rotation R(k) = ( c(k) s(k) ) = ( -s(k) c(k) ). When PIVOT = 'V' (Variable pivot), the rotation is performed for the plane (k,k+1), i.e., P(k) has the form P(k) = ( 1 ) ( ... ) ( 1 ) ( c(k) s(k) ) ( -s(k) c(k) ) ( 1 ) ( ... ) ( 1 ) where R(k) appears as a rank-2 modification to the identity matrix in rows and columns k and k+1. When PIVOT = 'T' (Top pivot), the rotation is performed for the plane (1,k+1), so P(k) has the form P(k) = ( c(k) s(k) ) ( 1 ) ( ... ) ( 1 ) ( -s(k) c(k) ) ( 1 ) ( ... ) ( 1 ) where R(k) appears in rows and columns 1 and k+1. Similarly, when PIVOT = 'B' (Bottom pivot), the rotation is performed for the plane (k,z), giving P(k) the form P(k) = ( 1 ) ( ... ) ( 1 ) ( c(k) s(k) ) ( 1 ) ( ... ) ( 1 ) ( -s(k) c(k) ) where R(k) appears in rows and columns k and z. The rotations are performed without ever forming P(k) explicitly.

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes the singular value decomposition of a 2-by-2 triangular matrix [ F G ] [ 0 H ].

param.name: f
param.pre: The (1,1) element of the 2-by-2 matrix.

param.name: g
param.pre: The (1,2) element of the 2-by-2 matrix.

param.name: h
param.pre: The (2,2) element of the 2-by-2 matrix.

param.name: ssmin
param.pre: abs(SSMIN) is the smaller singular value.

param.name: ssmax
param.pre: abs(SSMAX) is the larger singular value.

param.name: csl
param.pre: The vector (CSL, SNL) is a unit left singular vector for the singular value abs(SSMAX).

param.name: csr
param.pre: The vector (CSR, SNR) is a unit right singular vector for the singular value abs(SSMAX).

para.pre: On return, abs(SSMAX) is the larger singular value, abs(SSMIN) is the smaller singular value, and (CSL,SNL) and (CSR,SNR) are the left and right singular vectors for abs(SSMAX), giving the decomposition [ CSL SNL ] [ F G ] [ CSR -SNR ] = [ SSMAX 0 ] [-SNL CSL ] [ 0 H ] [ SNR CSR ] [ 0 SSMIN ].

Any input parameter may be aliased with any output parameter. Barring over/underflow and assuming a guard digit in subtraction, all output quantities are correct to within a few units in the last place (ulps). In IEEE arithmetic, the code works correctly if one matrix element is infinite. Overflow will not occur unless the largest singular value itself overflows or is within a few ulps of overflow. (On machines with partial overflow, like the Cray, overflow may occur if the largest singular value is within a factor of 2 of overflow.) Underflow is harmless if underflow is gradual. Otherwise, results may correspond to a matrix modified by perturbations of size near the underflow threshold.

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes the singular value decomposition (SVD) of a real (upper or lower) bidiagonal matrix with diagonal D and offdiagonal E, accumulating the transformations if desired.

param.name: uplo
param.pre: n entry, UPLO specifies whether the input bidiagonal matrix is upper or lower bidiagonal, and wether it is square are not. UPLO = 'U' or 'u' B is upper bidiagonal. UPLO = 'L' or 'l' B is lower bidiagonal.

param.name: sqre
param.pre: = 0: then the input matrix is N-by-N. = 1: then the input matrix is N-by-(N+1) if UPLU = 'U' and (N+1)-by-N if UPLU = 'L'. The bidiagonal matrix has N = NL + NR + 1 rows and M = N + SQRE >= N columns.

param.name: n
param.pre: n entry, N specifies the number of rows and columns in the matrix. N must be at least 0.

param.name: ncvt
param.pre: n entry, NCVT specifies the number of columns of the matrix VT. NCVT must be at least 0.

param.name: nru
param.pre: n entry, NRU specifies the number of rows of the matrix U. NRU must be at least 0.

param.name: ncc
param.pre: n entry, NCC specifies the number of columns of the matrix C. NCC must be at least 0.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (N) n entry, D contains the diagonal entries of the bidiagonal matrix whose SVD is desired. On normal exit, D contains the singular values in ascending order.

param.name: e
param.pre: E is DOUBLE PRECISION array. imension is (N-1) if SQRE = 0 and N if SQRE = 1. On entry, the entries of E contain the offdiagonal entries of the bidiagonal matrix whose SVD is desired. On normal exit, E will contain 0. If the algorithm does not converge, D and E will contain the diagonal and super-diagonal entries of a bidiagonal matrix orthogonally equivalent to the one given as input.

param.name: vt
param.pre: Dimension (LDVT, NCVT) n entry, contains a matrix which on exit has been premultiplied by PT, dimension N-by-NCVT if SQRE = 0 and (N+1)-by-NCVT if SQRE = 1 (not referenced if NCVT=0).
n entry, LDVT specifies the leading dimension of VT as declared in the calling (sub) program. LDVT must be at least 1. If NCVT is nonzero LDVT must also be at least N.

param.name: u
param.pre: Dimension (LDU, N) n entry, contains a matrix which on exit has been postmultiplied by Q, dimension NRU-by-N if SQRE = 0 and NRU-by-(N+1) if SQRE = 1 (not referenced if NRU=0).
n entry, LDU specifies the leading dimension of U as declared in the calling (sub) program. LDU must be at least max( 1, NRU ) .

param.name: c
param.pre: Dimension (LDC, NCC) n entry, contains an N-by-NCC matrix which on exit has been premultiplied by QT dimension N-by-NCC if SQRE = 0 and (N+1)-by-NCC if SQRE = 1 (not referenced if NCC=0).
n entry, LDC specifies the leading dimension of C as declared in the calling (sub) program. LDC must be at least 1. If NCC is nonzero, LDC must also be at least N.

param.name: work
param.pre: Dimension (4*N) orkspace. Only referenced if one of NCVT, NRU, or NCC is nonzero, and if N is at least 2.

param.name: info
param.pre: n exit, a value of 0 indicates a successful exit. If INFO < 0, argument number -INFO is illegal. If INFO > 0, the algorithm did not converge, and INFO specifies how many superdiagonals did not converge.

para.pre: Letting B denote the input bidiagonal matrix, the algorithm computes orthogonal matrices Q and P such that B = Q * S * PT (PT denotes the transpose of P). The singular values S are overwritten on D. The input matrix U is changed to U * Q if desired. The input matrix VT is changed to PT * VT if desired. The input matrix C is changed to QT * C if desired. See "Computing Small Singular Values of Bidiagonal Matrices With Guaranteed High Relative Accuracy," by J. Demmel and W. Kahan, LAPACK Working Note #3, for a detailed description of the algorithm.

remarks.para: Ming Gu and Huan Ren, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Creates a tree of subproblems for bidiagonal divide and conquer.

param.name: n
param.pre: On entry, the number of diagonal elements of the bidiagonal matrix.

param.name: lvl
param.pre: On exit, the number of levels on the computation tree.

param.name: nd
param.pre: On exit, the number of nodes on the tree.

param.name: inode
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) On exit, centers of subproblems.

param.name: ndiml
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) On exit, row dimensions of left children.

param.name: ndimr
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) On exit, row dimensions of right children.

param.name: msub
param.pre: On entry, the maximum row dimension each subproblem at the bottom of the tree can be of.

remarks.para: Ming Gu and Huan Ren, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: A divide and conquer approach, DLASD0 computes the singular value decomposition (SVD) of a real upper bidiagonal N-by-M matrix B with diagonal D and offdiagonal E, where M = N + SQRE.

param.name: n
param.pre: On entry, the row dimension of the upper bidiagonal matrix. This is also the dimension of the main diagonal array D.

param.name: sqre
d
param.pre: Dimension (N) On entry D contains the main diagonal of the bidiagonal matrix. On exit D, if INFO = 0, contains its singular values.

param.name: e
param.pre: Dimension (M-1) Contains the sub-diagonal entries of the bidiagonal matrix. On exit, E has been destroyed.

param.name: u
param.pre: Dimension at least (LDQ, N) On exit, U contains the left singular vectors.
On entry, leading dimension of U.

param.name: vt
param.pre: Dimension at least (LDVT, M) On exit, VTT contains the right singular vectors.
On entry, leading dimension of VT.

param.name: smlsiz
param.pre: On entry, maximum size of the subproblems at the bottom of the computation tree.

param.name: iwork
param.pre: IWORK is INTEGER work array. Dimension must be at least (8 * N)

param.name: work
param.pre: WORK is DOUBLE PRECISION work array. Dimension must be at least (3 * M**2 + 2 * M)

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. > 0: if INFO = 1, a singular value did not converge

para.pre: The algorithm computes orthogonal matrices U and VT such that B = U * S * VT. The singular values S are overwritten on D. A related subroutine, DLASDA, computes only the singular values, and optionally, the singular vectors in compact form.

remarks.para: Ming Gu and Huan Ren, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Merges the two sets of singular values together into a single sorted set.

param.name: icompq
param.pre: Specifies whether singular vectors are to be computed in compact form, as follows: = 0: Compute singular values only. = 1: Compute singular vectors of upper bidiagonal matrix in compact form.

param.name: nl
param.pre: The row dimension of the upper block. NL >= 1.

param.name: nr
param.pre: The row dimension of the lower block. NR >= 1.

param.name: sqre
param.pre: = 0: the lower block is an NR-by-NR square matrix. = 1: the lower block is an NR-by-(NR+1) rectangular matrix. The bidiagonal matrix has N = NL + NR + 1 rows and M = N + SQRE >= N columns.

param.name: k
param.pre: Contains the dimension of the non-deflated matrix, this is the order of the related secular equation. 1 <= K <=N.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) On entry D contains the singular values of the two submatrices to be combined. On exit D contains the trailing (N-K) updated singular values (those which were deflated) sorted into increasing order.

param.name: z
param.pre: Dimension ( M ) On exit Z contains the updating row vector in the secular equation.

param.name: zw
param.pre: Dimension ( M ) Workspace for Z.

param.name: vf
param.pre: Dimension ( M ) On entry, VF(1:NL+1) contains the first components of all right singular vectors of the upper block; and VF(NL+2:M) contains the first components of all right singular vectors of the lower block. On exit, VF contains the first components of all right singular vectors of the bidiagonal matrix.

param.name: vfw
param.pre: Dimension ( M ) Workspace for VF.

param.name: vl
param.pre: Dimension ( M ) On entry, VL(1:NL+1) contains the last components of all right singular vectors of the upper block; and VL(NL+2:M) contains the last components of all right singular vectors of the lower block. On exit, VL contains the last components of all right singular vectors of the bidiagonal matrix.

param.name: vlw
param.pre: Dimension ( M ) Workspace for VL.

param.name: alpha
param.pre: Contains the diagonal element associated with the added row.

param.name: beta
param.pre: Contains the off-diagonal element associated with the added row.

param.name: dsigma
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) Contains a copy of the diagonal elements (K-1 singular values and one zero) in the secular equation.

param.name: idx
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) This will contain the permutation used to sort the contents of D into ascending order.

param.name: idxp
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) This will contain the permutation used to place deflated values of D at the end of the array. On return IDXP(2:K) points to the nondeflated D-values and IDXP(K+1:N) points to the deflated singular values.

param.name: idxq
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) This contains the permutation which separately sorts the two sub-problems in D into ascending order. Note that entries in the first half of this permutation must first be moved one position backward; and entries in the second half must first have NL+1 added to their values.

param.name: perm
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) The permutations (from deflation and sorting) to be applied to each singular block. Not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0.

param.name: givptr
param.pre: The number of Givens rotations which took place in this subproblem. Not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0.

param.name: givcol
param.pre: Dimension ( LDGCOL, 2 ) Each pair of numbers indicates a pair of columns to take place in a Givens rotation. Not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0.

param.name: ldgcol
param.pre: The leading dimension of GIVCOL, must be at least N.

param.name: givnum
param.pre: Dimension ( LDGNUM, 2 ) Each number indicates the C or S value to be used in the corresponding Givens rotation. Not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0.

param.name: ldgnum
param.pre: The leading dimension of GIVNUM, must be at least N.

param.name: c
param.pre: C contains garbage if SQRE =0 and the C-value of a Givens rotation related to the right null space if SQRE = 1.

param.name: s
param.pre: S contains garbage if SQRE =0 and the S-value of a Givens rotation related to the right null space if SQRE = 1.

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value.

para.pre: Then it tries to deflate the size of the problem. There are two ways in which deflation can occur: when two or more singular values are close together or if there is a tiny entry in the Z vector. For each such occurrence the order of the related secular equation problem is reduced by one. DLASD7 is called from DLASD6.

remarks.para: Ming Gu and Huan Ren, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Finds the square roots of the roots of the secular equation, as defined by the values in DSIGMA and Z.

param.name: icompq
param.pre: Specifies whether singular vectors are to be computed in factored form in the calling routine: = 0: Compute singular values only. = 1: Compute singular vectors in factored form as well.

param.name: k
param.pre: The number of terms in the rational function to be solved by DLASD4. K >= 1.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension ( K ) On return, D contains the updated singular values.

param.name: z
param.pre: Dimension ( K ) On entry, the first K elements of this array contain the components of the deflation-adjusted updating row vector. On exit, Z is updated.

param.name: vf
param.pre: Dimension ( K ) On entry, VF contains information passed through DBEDE8. On exit, VF contains the first K components of the first components of all right singular vectors of the bidiagonal matrix.

param.name: vl
param.pre: Dimension ( K ) On entry, VL contains information passed through DBEDE8. On exit, VL contains the first K components of the last components of all right singular vectors of the bidiagonal matrix.

param.name: difl
param.pre: Dimension ( K ) On exit, DIFL(I) = D(I) - DSIGMA(I).

param.name: difr
param.pre: DIFR is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension ( LDDIFR, 2 ) if ICOMPQ = 1 and dimension ( K ) if ICOMPQ = 0. On exit, DIFR(I,1) = D(I) - DSIGMA(I+1), DIFR(K,1) is not defined and will not be referenced. If ICOMPQ = 1, DIFR(1:K,2) is an array containing the normalizing factors for the right singular vector matrix.
The leading dimension of DIFR, must be at least K.

param.name: dsigma
param.pre: Dimension ( K ) On entry, the first K elements of this array contain the old roots of the deflated updating problem. These are the poles of the secular equation. On exit, the elements of DSIGMA may be very slightly altered in value.

param.name: work
param.pre: Dimension at least 3 * K

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. > 0: if INFO = 1, a singular value did not converge

para.pre: It makes the appropriate calls to DLASD4, and stores, for each element in D, the distance to its two nearest poles (elements in DSIGMA). It also updates the arrays VF and VL, the first and last components of all the right singular vectors of the original bidiagonal matrix. DLASD8 is called from DLASD6.

remarks.para: Ming Gu and Huan Ren, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes the SVD of an updated upper bidiagonal matrix B obtained by merging two smaller ones by appending a row.

param.name: icompq
param.pre: Specifies whether singular vectors are to be computed in factored form: = 0: Compute singular values only. = 1: Compute singular vectors in factored form as well.

param.name: nl
param.pre: The row dimension of the upper block. NL >= 1.

param.name: nr
param.pre: The row dimension of the lower block. NR >= 1.

param.name: sqre
param.pre: = 0: the lower block is an NR-by-NR square matrix. = 1: the lower block is an NR-by-(NR+1) rectangular matrix. The bidiagonal matrix has row dimension N = NL + NR + 1, and column dimension M = N + SQRE.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension ( NL+NR+1 ). On entry D(1:NL,1:NL) contains the singular values of the upper block, and D(NL+2:N) contains the singular values of the lower block. On exit D(1:N) contains the singular values of the modified matrix.

param.name: vf
param.pre: Dimension ( M ) On entry, VF(1:NL+1) contains the first components of all right singular vectors of the upper block; and VF(NL+2:M) contains the first components of all right singular vectors of the lower block. On exit, VF contains the first components of all right singular vectors of the bidiagonal matrix.

param.name: vl
param.pre: Dimension ( M ) On entry, VL(1:NL+1) contains the last components of all right singular vectors of the upper block; and VL(NL+2:M) contains the last components of all right singular vectors of the lower block. On exit, VL contains the last components of all right singular vectors of the bidiagonal matrix.

param.name: alpha
param.pre: Contains the diagonal element associated with the added row.

param.name: beta
param.pre: Contains the off-diagonal element associated with the added row.

param.name: idxq
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) This contains the permutation which will reintegrate the subproblem just solved back into sorted order, i.e. D( IDXQ( I = 1, N ) ) will be in ascending order.

param.name: perm
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) The permutations (from deflation and sorting) to be applied to each block. Not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0.

param.name: givptr
param.pre: The number of Givens rotations which took place in this subproblem. Not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0.

param.name: givcol
param.pre: Dimension ( LDGCOL, 2 ) Each pair of numbers indicates a pair of columns to take place in a Givens rotation. Not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0.

param.name: ldgcol
param.pre: leading dimension of GIVCOL, must be at least N.

param.name: givnum
param.pre: Dimension ( LDGNUM, 2 ) Each number indicates the C or S value to be used in the corresponding Givens rotation. Not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0.

param.name: ldgnum
param.pre: The leading dimension of GIVNUM and POLES, must be at least N.

param.name: poles
param.pre: Dimension ( LDGNUM, 2 ) On exit, POLES(1,*) is an array containing the new singular values obtained from solving the secular equation, and POLES(2,*) is an array containing the poles in the secular equation. Not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0.

param.name: difl
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) On exit, DIFL(I) is the distance between I-th updated (undeflated) singular value and the I-th (undeflated) old singular value.

param.name: difr
param.pre: DIFR is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension ( LDGNUM, 2 ) if ICOMPQ = 1 and dimension ( N ) if ICOMPQ = 0. On exit, DIFR(I, 1) is the distance between I-th updated (undeflated) singular value and the I+1-th (undeflated) old singular value. If ICOMPQ = 1, DIFR(1:K,2) is an array containing the normalizing factors for the right singular vector matrix. See DLASD8 for details on DIFL and DIFR.

param.name: z
param.pre: Dimension ( M ) The first elements of this array contain the components of the deflation-adjusted updating row vector.

param.name: k
param.pre: Contains the dimension of the non-deflated matrix, This is the order of the related secular equation. 1 <= K <=N.

param.name: c
param.pre: C contains garbage if SQRE =0 and the C-value of a Givens rotation related to the right null space if SQRE = 1.

param.name: s
param.pre: S contains garbage if SQRE =0 and the S-value of a Givens rotation related to the right null space if SQRE = 1.

param.name: work
param.pre: Dimension ( 4 * M )

param.name: iwork
param.pre: Dimension ( 3 * N )

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. > 0: if INFO = 1, a singular value did not converge

para.pre: This routine is used only for the problem which requires all singular values and optionally singular vector matrices in factored form. B is an N-by-M matrix with N = NL + NR + 1 and M = N + SQRE. A related subroutine, DLASD1, handles the case in which all singular values and singular vectors of the bidiagonal matrix are desired. DLASD6 computes the SVD as follows: ( D1(in) 0 0 0 ) B = U(in) * ( Z1**T a Z2**T b ) * VT(in) ( 0 0 D2(in) 0 ) = U(out) * ( D(out) 0) * VT(out) where ZT = (Z1**T a Z2**T b) = u**T VTT, and u is a vector of dimension M with ALPHA and BETA in the NL+1 and NL+2 th entries and zeros elsewhere; and the entry b is empty if SQRE = 0. The singular values of B can be computed using D1, D2, the first components of all the right singular vectors of the lower block, and the last components of all the right singular vectors of the upper block. These components are stored and updated in VF and VL, respectively, in DLASD6. Hence U and VT are not explicitly referenced. The singular values are stored in D. The algorithm consists of two stages: The first stage consists of deflating the size of the problem when there are multiple singular values or if there is a zero in the Z vector. For each such occurence the dimension of the secular equation problem is reduced by one. This stage is performed by the routine DLASD7. The second stage consists of calculating the updated singular values. This is done by finding the roots of the secular equation via the routine DLASD4 (as called by DLASD8). This routine also updates VF and VL and computes the distances between the updated singular values and the old singular values. DLASD6 is called from DLASDA.

remarks.para: Ming Gu and Huan Ren, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: A divide and conquer approach, DLASDA computes the singular value decomposition (SVD) of a real upper bidiagonal N-by-M matrix B with diagonal D and offdiagonal E, where M = N + SQRE.

param.name: icompq
param.pre: Specifies whether singular vectors are to be computed in compact form, as follows = 0: Compute singular values only. = 1: Compute singular vectors of upper bidiagonal matrix in compact form.

param.name: smlsiz
param.pre: The maximum size of the subproblems at the bottom of the computation tree.

param.name: n
param.pre: The row dimension of the upper bidiagonal matrix. This is also the dimension of the main diagonal array D.

param.name: sqre
d
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) On entry D contains the main diagonal of the bidiagonal matrix. On exit D, if INFO = 0, contains its singular values.

param.name: e
param.pre: Dimension ( M-1 ) Contains the sub-diagonal entries of the bidiagonal matrix. On exit, E has been destroyed.

param.name: u
param.pre: U is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension ( LDU, SMLSIZ ) if ICOMPQ = 1, and not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1, on exit, U contains the left singular vector matrices of all subproblems at the bottom level.
LDU is INTEGER, LDU = > N. The leading dimension of arrays U, VT, DIFL, DIFR, POLES, GIVNUM, and Z.

param.name: vt
param.pre: VT is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension ( LDU, SMLSIZ+1 ) if ICOMPQ = 1, and not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1, on exit, VTT contains the right singular vector matrices of all subproblems at the bottom level.

param.name: k
param.pre: K is INTEGER array, dimension ( N ) if ICOMPQ = 1 and dimension 1 if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1, on exit, K(I) is the dimension of the I-th secular equation on the computation tree.

param.name: difl
param.pre: Dimension ( LDU, NLVL ), where NLVL = floor(log_2 (N/SMLSIZ))).

param.name: difr
param.pre: DIFR is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension ( LDU, 2 * NLVL ) if ICOMPQ = 1 and dimension ( N ) if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1, on exit, DIFL(1:N, I) and DIFR(1:N, 2 * I - 1) record distances between singular values on the I-th level and singular values on the (I -1)-th level, and DIFR(1:N, 2 * I ) contains the normalizing factors for the right singular vector matrix. See DLASD8 for details.

param.name: z
param.pre: Z is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension ( LDU, NLVL ) if ICOMPQ = 1 and dimension ( N ) if ICOMPQ = 0. The first K elements of Z(1, I) contain the components of the deflation-adjusted updating row vector for subproblems on the I-th level.

param.name: poles
param.pre: POLES is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension ( LDU, 2 * NLVL ) if ICOMPQ = 1, and not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1, on exit, POLES(1, 2*I - 1) and POLES(1, 2*I) contain the new and old singular values involved in the secular equations on the I-th level.

param.name: givptr
param.pre: GIVPTR is INTEGER array, dimension ( N ) if ICOMPQ = 1, and not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1, on exit, GIVPTR( I ) records the number of Givens rotations performed on the I-th problem on the computation tree.

param.name: givcol
param.pre: GIVCOL is INTEGER array, dimension ( LDGCOL, 2 * NLVL ) if ICOMPQ = 1, and not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1, on exit, for each I, GIVCOL(1, 2 *I - 1) and GIVCOL(1, 2 *I) record the locations of Givens rotations performed on the I-th level on the computation tree.

param.name: ldgcol
param.pre: LDGCOL is INTEGER, LDGCOL = > N. The leading dimension of arrays GIVCOL and PERM.

param.name: perm
param.pre: PERM is INTEGER array, dimension ( LDGCOL, NLVL ) if ICOMPQ = 1, and not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1, on exit, PERM(1, I) records permutations done on the I-th level of the computation tree.

param.name: givnum
param.pre: GIVNUM is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension ( LDU, 2 * NLVL ) if ICOMPQ = 1, and not referenced if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1, on exit, for each I, GIVNUM(1, 2 *I - 1) and GIVNUM(1, 2 *I) record the C- and S- values of Givens rotations performed on the I-th level on the computation tree.

param.name: c
param.pre: C is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension ( N ) if ICOMPQ = 1, and dimension 1 if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1 and the I-th subproblem is not square, on exit, C( I ) contains the C-value of a Givens rotation related to the right null space of the I-th subproblem.

param.name: s
param.pre: Dimension ( N ) if ICOMPQ = 1, and dimension 1 if ICOMPQ = 0. If ICOMPQ = 1 and the I-th subproblem is not square, on exit, S( I ) contains the S-value of a Givens rotation related to the right null space of the I-th subproblem.

param.name: work
param.pre: Dimension (6 * N + (SMLSIZ + 1)*(SMLSIZ + 1)).

param.name: iwork
param.pre: IWORK is INTEGER array. Dimension must be at least (7 * N).

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. > 0: if INFO = 1, a singular value did not converge

para.pre: The algorithm computes the singular values in the SVD B = U * S * VT. The orthogonal matrices U and VT are optionally computed in compact form. A related subroutine, DLASD0, computes the singular values and the singular vectors in explicit form.

remarks.para: Ming Gu and Huan Ren, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Reduces the first NB rows and columns of a real general m by n matrix A to upper or lower bidiagonal form by an orthogonal transformation QT * A * P, and returns the matrices X and Y which are needed to apply the transformation to the unreduced part of A.

param.name: m
param.pre: The number of rows in the matrix A.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns in the matrix A.

param.name: nb
param.pre: The number of leading rows and columns of A to be reduced.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the m by n general matrix to be reduced. On exit, the first NB rows and columns of the matrix are overwritten; the rest of the array is unchanged. If m >= n, elements on and below the diagonal in the first NB columns, with the array TAUQ, represent the orthogonal matrix Q as a product of elementary reflectors; and elements above the diagonal in the first NB rows, with the array TAUP, represent the orthogonal matrix P as a product of elementary reflectors. If m < n, elements below the diagonal in the first NB columns, with the array TAUQ, represent the orthogonal matrix Q as a product of elementary reflectors, and elements on and above the diagonal in the first NB rows, with the array TAUP, represent the orthogonal matrix P as a product of elementary reflectors. See Further Details.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,M).

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (NB) The diagonal elements of the first NB rows and columns of the reduced matrix. D(i) = A(i,i).

param.name: e
param.pre: Dimension (NB) The off-diagonal elements of the first NB rows and columns of the reduced matrix.

param.name: tauq
param.pre: TAUQ is DOUBLE PRECISION array dimension (NB) The scalar factors of the elementary reflectors which represent the orthogonal matrix Q. See Further Details.

param.name: taup
param.pre: Dimension (NB) The scalar factors of the elementary reflectors which represent the orthogonal matrix P. See Further Details.

param.name: x
param.pre: Dimension (LDX,NB) The m-by-nb matrix X required to update the unreduced part of A.
The leading dimension of the array X. LDX >= max(1,M).

param.name: y
param.pre: Dimension (LDY,NB) The n-by-nb matrix Y required to update the unreduced part of A.
The leading dimension of the array Y. LDY >= max(1,N).

para.pre: If m >= n, A is reduced to upper bidiagonal form; if m < n, to lower bidiagonal form. This is an auxiliary routine called by DGEBRD

The matrices Q and P are represented as products of elementary reflectors: Q = H(1) H(2) . . . H(nb) and P = G(1) G(2) . . . G(nb) Each H(i) and G(i) has the form: H(i) = I - tauq * v * v**T and G(i) = I - taup * u * u**T where tauq and taup are real scalars, and v and u are real vectors. If m >= n, v(1:i-1) = 0, v(i) = 1, and v(i:m) is stored on exit in A(i:m,i); u(1:i) = 0, u(i+1) = 1, and u(i+1:n) is stored on exit in A(i,i+1:n); tauq is stored in TAUQ(i) and taup in TAUP(i). If m < n, v(1:i) = 0, v(i+1) = 1, and v(i+1:m) is stored on exit in A(i+2:m,i); u(1:i-1) = 0, u(i) = 1, and u(i:n) is stored on exit in A(i,i+1:n); tauq is stored in TAUQ(i) and taup in TAUP(i). The elements of the vectors v and u together form the m-by-nb matrix V and the nb-by-n matrix UT which are needed, with X and Y, to apply the transformation to the unreduced part of the matrix, using a block update of the form: A := A - V*YT - X*UT. The contents of A on exit are illustrated by the following examples with nb = 2: m = 6 and n = 5 (m > n): m = 5 and n = 6 (m < n): ( 1 1 u1 u1 u1 ) ( 1 u1 u1 u1 u1 u1 ) ( v1 1 1 u2 u2 ) ( 1 1 u2 u2 u2 u2 ) ( v1 v2 a a a ) ( v1 1 a a a a ) ( v1 v2 a a a ) ( v1 v2 a a a a ) ( v1 v2 a a a ) ( v1 v2 a a a a ) ( v1 v2 a a a ) where a denotes an element of the original matrix which is unchanged, vi denotes an element of the vector defining H(i), and ui an element of the vector defining G(i).

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Rearranges the columns of the M by N matrix X as specified by the permutation K(1),K(2),.

param.name: forwrd
param.pre: = .TRUE., forward permutation = .FALSE., backward permutation

param.name: m
param.pre: The number of rows of the matrix X. M >= 0.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns of the matrix X. N >= 0.

param.name: x
param.pre: Dimension (LDX,N) On entry, the M by N matrix X. On exit, X contains the permuted matrix X.
The leading dimension of the array X, LDX >= MAX(1,M).

param.name: k
param.pre: Dimension (N) On entry, K contains the permutation vector. K is used as internal workspace, but reset to its original value on output.

para.pre: If FORWRD = .TRUE., forward permutation: X(*,K(J)) is moved X(*,J) for J = 1,2,...,N. If FORWRD = .FALSE., backward permutation: X(*,J) is moved to X(*,K(J)) for J = 1,2,...,N.

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes 2-by-2 orthogonal matrices U, V and Q, such that if ( UPPER ) then UT *A*Q = UT *( A1 A2 )*Q = ( x 0 ) ( 0 A3 ) ( x x ) and VT*B*Q = VT *( B1 B2 )*Q = ( x 0 ) ( 0 B3 ) ( x x ) or if ( .

param.name: upper
param.pre: = .TRUE.: the input matrices A and B are upper triangular. = .FALSE.: the input matrices A and B are lower triangular.

param.name: a3
param.pre: On entry, A1, A2 and A3 are elements of the input 2-by-2 upper (lower) triangular matrix A.

param.name: b3
param.pre: On entry, B1, B2 and B3 are elements of the input 2-by-2 upper (lower) triangular matrix B.

param.name: snu
param.pre: The desired orthogonal matrix U.

param.name: snv
param.pre: The desired orthogonal matrix V.

param.name: snq
param.pre: The desired orthogonal matrix Q.

para.pre: NOT.UPPER ) then UT *A*Q = UT *( A1 0 )*Q = ( x x ) ( A2 A3 ) ( 0 x ) and VT*B*Q = VT*( B1 0 )*Q = ( x x ) ( B2 B3 ) ( 0 x ) The rows of the transformed A and B are parallel, where U = ( CSU SNU ), V = ( CSV SNV ), Q = ( CSQ SNQ ) ( -SNU CSU ) ( -SNV CSV ) ( -SNQ CSQ ) ZT denotes the transpose of Z.

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Two column vectors X and Y, let A = ( X Y ).

param.name: n
param.pre: The length of the vectors X and Y.

param.name: x
param.pre: X is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension (1+(N-1)*INCX) On entry, X contains the N-vector X. On exit, X is overwritten.
The increment between successive elements of X. INCX > 0.

param.name: y
param.pre: Y is DOUBLE PRECISION array, dimension (1+(N-1)*INCY) On entry, Y contains the N-vector Y. On exit, Y is overwritten.
The increment between successive elements of Y. INCY > 0.

param.name: ssmin
param.pre: The smallest singular value of the N-by-2 matrix A = ( X Y ).

para.pre: The subroutine first computes the QR factorization of A = Q*R, and then computes the SVD of the 2-by-2 upper triangular matrix R. The smaller singular value of R is returned in SSMIN, which is used as the measurement of the linear dependency of the vectors X and Y.

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes the generalized singular value decomposition (GSVD) of two real upper triangular (or trapezoidal) matrices A and B.

param.name: jobu
jobv
jobq
m
param.pre: The number of rows of the matrix A. M >= 0.

param.name: p
param.pre: The number of rows of the matrix B. P >= 0.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns of the matrices A and B. N >= 0.

param.name: l
param.pre: K and L specify the subblocks in the input matrices A and B: A23 = A(K+1:MIN(K+L,M),N-L+1:N) and B13 = B(1:L,N-L+1:N) of A and B, whose GSVD is going to be computed by DTGSJA. See Further Details.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the M-by-N matrix A. On exit, A(N-K+1:N,1:MIN(K+L,M) ) contains the triangular matrix R or part of R. See Purpose for details.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,M).

param.name: b
param.pre: Dimension (LDB,N) On entry, the P-by-N matrix B. On exit, if necessary, B(M-K+1:L,N+M-K-L+1:N) contains a part of R. See Purpose for details.
The leading dimension of the array B. LDB >= max(1,P).

param.name: tolb
param.pre: TOLA and TOLB are the convergence criteria for the Jacobi- Kogbetliantz iteration procedure. Generally, they are the same as used in the preprocessing step, say TOLA = max(M,N)*norm(A)*MAZHEPS, TOLB = max(P,N)*norm(B)*MAZHEPS.

param.name: alpha
param.pre: Dimension (N)

param.name: beta
param.pre: Dimension (N) On exit, ALPHA and BETA contain the generalized singular value pairs of A and B; ALPHA(1:K) = 1, BETA(1:K) = 0, and if M-K-L >= 0, ALPHA(K+1:K+L) = diag(C), BETA(K+1:K+L) = diag(S), or if M-K-L < 0, ALPHA(K+1:M)= C, ALPHA(M+1:K+L)= 0 BETA(K+1:M) = S, BETA(M+1:K+L) = 1. Furthermore, if K+L < N, ALPHA(K+L+1:N) = 0 and BETA(K+L+1:N) = 0.

param.name: u
param.pre: Dimension (LDU,M) On entry, if JOBU = 'U', U must contain a matrix U1 (usually the orthogonal matrix returned by DGGSVP). On exit, if JOBU = 'I', U contains the orthogonal matrix U; if JOBU = 'U', U contains the product U1*U. If JOBU = 'N', U is not referenced.
The leading dimension of the array U. LDU >= max(1,M) if JOBU = 'U'; LDU >= 1 otherwise.

param.name: v
param.pre: Dimension (LDV,P) On entry, if JOBV = 'V', V must contain a matrix V1 (usually the orthogonal matrix returned by DGGSVP). On exit, if JOBV = 'I', V contains the orthogonal matrix V; if JOBV = 'V', V contains the product V1*V. If JOBV = 'N', V is not referenced.
The leading dimension of the array V. LDV >= max(1,P) if JOBV = 'V'; LDV >= 1 otherwise.

param.name: q
param.pre: Dimension (LDQ,N) On entry, if JOBQ = 'Q', Q must contain a matrix Q1 (usually the orthogonal matrix returned by DGGSVP). On exit, if JOBQ = 'I', Q contains the orthogonal matrix Q; if JOBQ = 'Q', Q contains the product Q1*Q. If JOBQ = 'N', Q is not referenced.
The leading dimension of the array Q. LDQ >= max(1,N) if JOBQ = 'Q'; LDQ >= 1 otherwise.

param.name: work
param.pre: Dimension (2*N)

param.name: ncycle
param.pre: The number of cycles required for convergence.

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. = 1: the procedure does not converge after MAXIT cycles.
l Parameters ============= T INTEGER MAXIT specifies the total loops that the iterative procedure may take. If after MAXIT cycles, the routine fails to converge, we return INFO = 1.

para.pre: On entry, it is assumed that matrices A and B have the following forms, which may be obtained by the preprocessing subroutine DGGSVP from a general M-by-N matrix A and P-by-N matrix B: N-K-L K L A = K ( 0 A12 A13 ) if M-K-L >= 0; L ( 0 0 A23 ) M-K-L ( 0 0 0 ) N-K-L K L A = K ( 0 A12 A13 ) if M-K-L < 0; M-K ( 0 0 A23 ) N-K-L K L B = L ( 0 0 B13 ) P-L ( 0 0 0 ) where the K-by-K matrix A12 and L-by-L matrix B13 are nonsingular upper triangular; A23 is L-by-L upper triangular if M-K-L >= 0, otherwise A23 is (M-K)-by-L upper trapezoidal. On exit, UT *A*Q = D1*( 0 R ), VT *B*Q = D2*( 0 R ), where U, V and Q are orthogonal matrices. R is a nonsingular upper triangular matrix, and D1 and D2 are ``diagonal'' matrices, which are of the following structures: If M-K-L >= 0, K L D1 = K ( I 0 ) L ( 0 C ) M-K-L ( 0 0 ) K L D2 = L ( 0 S ) P-L ( 0 0 ) N-K-L K L ( 0 R ) = K ( 0 R11 R12 ) K L ( 0 0 R22 ) L where C = diag( ALPHA(K+1), ... , ALPHA(K+L) ), S = diag( BETA(K+1), ... , BETA(K+L) ), C**2 + S**2 = I. R is stored in A(1:K+L,N-K-L+1:N) on exit. If M-K-L < 0, K M-K K+L-M D1 = K ( I 0 0 ) M-K ( 0 C 0 ) K M-K K+L-M D2 = M-K ( 0 S 0 ) K+L-M ( 0 0 I ) P-L ( 0 0 0 ) N-K-L K M-K K+L-M ( 0 R ) = K ( 0 R11 R12 R13 ) M-K ( 0 0 R22 R23 ) K+L-M ( 0 0 0 R33 ) where C = diag( ALPHA(K+1), ... , ALPHA(M) ), S = diag( BETA(K+1), ... , BETA(M) ), C**2 + S**2 = I. R = ( R11 R12 R13 ) is stored in A(1:M, N-K-L+1:N) and R33 is stored ( 0 R22 R23 ) in B(M-K+1:L,N+M-K-L+1:N) on exit. The computation of the orthogonal transformation matrices U, V or Q is optional. These matrices may either be formed explicitly, or they may be postmultiplied into input matrices U1, V1, or Q1.

DTGSJA essentially uses a variant of Kogbetliantz algorithm to reduce min(L,M-K)-by-L triangular (or trapezoidal) matrix A23 and L-by-L matrix B13 to the form: U1**T *A13*Q1 = C1*R1; V1**T *B13*Q1 = S1*R1, where U1, V1 and Q1 are orthogonal matrix, and ZT is the transpose of Z. C1 and S1 are diagonal matrices satisfying C1**2 + S1**2 = I, and R1 is an L-by-L nonsingular upper triangular matrix.

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: November 2011

summary.para: Returns the value of the one norm, or the Frobenius norm, or the infinity norm, or the element of largest absolute value of a trapezoidal or triangular matrix A.

param.name: norm
param.pre: Specifies the value to be returned in DLANTR as described above.

param.name: uplo
param.pre: Specifies whether the matrix A is upper or lower trapezoidal. = 'U': Upper trapezoidal = 'L': Lower trapezoidal Note that A is triangular instead of trapezoidal if M = N.

param.name: diag
param.pre: Specifies whether or not the matrix A has unit diagonal. = 'N': Non-unit diagonal = 'U': Unit diagonal

param.name: m
param.pre: The number of rows of the matrix A. M >= 0, and if UPLO = 'U', M <= N. When M = 0, DLANTR is set to zero.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns of the matrix A. N >= 0, and if UPLO = 'L', N <= M. When N = 0, DLANTR is set to zero.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) The trapezoidal matrix A (A is triangular if M = N). If UPLO = 'U', the leading m by n upper trapezoidal part of the array A contains the upper trapezoidal matrix, and the strictly lower triangular part of A is not referenced. If UPLO = 'L', the leading m by n lower trapezoidal part of the array A contains the lower trapezoidal matrix, and the strictly upper triangular part of A is not referenced. Note that when DIAG = 'U', the diagonal elements of A are not referenced and are assumed to be one.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(M,1).

param.name: work
param.pre: Dimension (MAX(1,LWORK)), where LWORK >= M when NORM = 'I'; otherwise, WORK is not referenced.

remarks.pre: DLANTR = ( max(abs(A(i,j))), NORM = 'M' or 'm' ( ( norm1(A), NORM = '1', 'O' or 'o' ( ( normI(A), NORM = 'I' or 'i' ( ( normF(A), NORM = 'F', 'f', 'E' or 'e' ere norm1 denotes the one norm of a matrix (maximum column sum), ormI denotes the infinity norm of a matrix (maximum row sum) and normF denotes the Frobenius norm of a matrix (square root of sum of squares). Note that max(abs(A(i,j))) is not a consistent matrix norm.
remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes the product U * UT or LT * L, where the triangular factor U or L is stored in the upper or lower triangular part of the array A.

param.name: uplo
param.pre: Specifies whether the triangular factor stored in the array A is upper or lower triangular: = 'U': Upper triangular = 'L': Lower triangular

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the triangular factor U or L. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the triangular factor U or L. On exit, if UPLO = 'U', the upper triangle of A is overwritten with the upper triangle of the product U * UT; if UPLO = 'L', the lower triangle of A is overwritten with the lower triangle of the product LT * L.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit < 0: if INFO = -k, the k-th argument had an illegal value

para.pre: If UPLO = 'U' or 'u' then the upper triangle of the result is stored, overwriting the factor U in A. If UPLO = 'L' or 'l' then the lower triangle of the result is stored, overwriting the factor L in A. This is the unblocked form of the algorithm, calling Level 2 BLAS.

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes the product U * UT or LT * L, where the triangular factor U or L is stored in the upper or lower triangular part of the array A.

param.name: uplo
param.pre: Specifies whether the triangular factor stored in the array A is upper or lower triangular: = 'U': Upper triangular = 'L': Lower triangular

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the triangular factor U or L. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the triangular factor U or L. On exit, if UPLO = 'U', the upper triangle of A is overwritten with the upper triangle of the product U * UT; if UPLO = 'L', the lower triangle of A is overwritten with the lower triangle of the product LT * L.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit < 0: if INFO = -k, the k-th argument had an illegal value

para.pre: If UPLO = 'U' or 'u' then the upper triangle of the result is stored, overwriting the factor U in A. If UPLO = 'L' or 'l' then the lower triangle of the result is stored, overwriting the factor L in A. This is the blocked form of the algorithm, calling Level 3 BLAS.

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes a partial factorization of a real symmetric matrix A using the Bunch-Kaufman diagonal pivoting method.

param.name: uplo
param.pre: Specifies whether the upper or lower triangular part of the symmetric matrix A is stored: = 'U': Upper triangular = 'L': Lower triangular

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: nb
param.pre: The maximum number of columns of the matrix A that should be factored. NB should be at least 2 to allow for 2-by-2 pivot blocks.

param.name: kb
param.pre: The number of columns of A that were actually factored. KB is either NB-1 or NB, or N if N <= NB.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the symmetric matrix A. If UPLO = 'U', the leading n-by-n upper triangular part of A contains the upper triangular part of the matrix A, and the strictly lower triangular part of A is not referenced. If UPLO = 'L', the leading n-by-n lower triangular part of A contains the lower triangular part of the matrix A, and the strictly upper triangular part of A is not referenced. On exit, A contains details of the partial factorization.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (N) Details of the interchanges and the block structure of D. If UPLO = 'U', only the last KB elements of IPIV are set; if UPLO = 'L', only the first KB elements are set. If IPIV(k) > 0, then rows and columns k and IPIV(k) were interchanged and D(k,k) is a 1-by-1 diagonal block. If UPLO = 'U' and IPIV(k) = IPIV(k-1) < 0, then rows and columns k-1 and -IPIV(k) were interchanged and D(k-1:k,k-1:k) is a 2-by-2 diagonal block. If UPLO = 'L' and IPIV(k) = IPIV(k+1) < 0, then rows and columns k+1 and -IPIV(k) were interchanged and D(k:k+1,k:k+1) is a 2-by-2 diagonal block.

param.name: w
param.pre: Dimension (LDW,NB)
The leading dimension of the array W. LDW >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit > 0: if INFO = k, D(k,k) is exactly zero. The factorization has been completed, but the block diagonal matrix D is exactly singular.

para.pre: The partial factorization has the form: A = ( I U12 ) ( A11 0 ) ( I 0 ) if UPLO = 'U', or: ( 0 U22 ) ( 0 D ) ( U12**T U22**T ) A = ( L11 0 ) ( D 0 ) ( L11**T L21**T ) if UPLO = 'L' ( L21 I ) ( 0 A22 ) ( 0 I ) where the order of D is at most NB. The actual order is returned in the argument KB, and is either NB or NB-1, or N if N <= NB. DLASYF is an auxiliary routine called by DSYTRF. It uses blocked code (calling Level 3 BLAS) to update the sub-matrix A11 (if UPLO = 'U') or A22 (if UPLO = 'L').

remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Returns the value of the one norm, or the Frobenius norm, or the infinity norm, or the element of largest absolute value of a real symmetric matrix A.

param.name: norm
param.pre: Specifies the value to be returned in DLANSY as described above.

param.name: uplo
param.pre: Specifies whether the upper or lower triangular part of the symmetric matrix A is to be referenced. = 'U': Upper triangular part of A is referenced = 'L': Lower triangular part of A is referenced

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0. When N = 0, DLANSY is set to zero.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) The symmetric matrix A. If UPLO = 'U', the leading n by n upper triangular part of A contains the upper triangular part of the matrix A, and the strictly lower triangular part of A is not referenced. If UPLO = 'L', the leading n by n lower triangular part of A contains the lower triangular part of the matrix A, and the strictly upper triangular part of A is not referenced.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(N,1).

param.name: work
param.pre: Dimension (MAX(1,LWORK)), where LWORK >= N when NORM = 'I' or '1' or 'O'; otherwise, WORK is not referenced.

remarks.pre: DLANSY = ( max(abs(A(i,j))), NORM = 'M' or 'm' ( ( norm1(A), NORM = '1', 'O' or 'o' ( ( normI(A), NORM = 'I' or 'i' ( ( normF(A), NORM = 'F', 'f', 'E' or 'e' ere norm1 denotes the one norm of a matrix (maximum column sum), ormI denotes the infinity norm of a matrix (maximum row sum) and normF denotes the Frobenius norm of a matrix (square root of sum of squares). Note that max(abs(A(i,j))) is not a consistent matrix norm.
remarks.para: Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Merges the two sets of eigenvalues together into a single sorted set.

param.name: k
param.pre: The number of non-deflated eigenvalues, and the order of the related secular equation. 0 <= K <=N.

param.name: n
param.pre: The dimension of the symmetric tridiagonal matrix. N >= 0.

param.name: n1
param.pre: The location of the last eigenvalue in the leading sub-matrix. min(1,N) <= N1 <= N/2.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (N) On entry, D contains the eigenvalues of the two submatrices to be combined. On exit, D contains the trailing (N-K) updated eigenvalues (those which were deflated) sorted into increasing order.

param.name: q
param.pre: Dimension (LDQ, N) On entry, Q contains the eigenvectors of two submatrices in the two square blocks with corners at (1,1), (N1,N1) and (N1+1, N1+1), (N,N). On exit, Q contains the trailing (N-K) updated eigenvectors (those which were deflated) in its last N-K columns.
The leading dimension of the array Q. LDQ >= max(1,N).

param.name: indxq
param.pre: Dimension (N) The permutation which separately sorts the two sub-problems in D into ascending order. Note that elements in the second half of this permutation must first have N1 added to their values. Destroyed on exit.

param.name: rho
param.pre: On entry, the off-diagonal element associated with the rank-1 cut which originally split the two submatrices which are now being recombined. On exit, RHO has been modified to the value required by DLAED3.

param.name: z
param.pre: Dimension (N) On entry, Z contains the updating vector (the last row of the first sub-eigenvector matrix and the first row of the second sub-eigenvector matrix). On exit, the contents of Z have been destroyed by the updating process.

param.name: dlamda
param.pre: Dimension (N) A copy of the first K eigenvalues which will be used by DLAED3 to form the secular equation.

param.name: w
param.pre: Dimension (N) The first k values of the final deflation-altered z-vector which will be passed to DLAED3.

param.name: q2
param.pre: Dimension (N1**2+(N-N1)**2) A copy of the first K eigenvectors which will be used by DLAED3 in a matrix multiply (DGEMM) to solve for the new eigenvectors.

param.name: indx
param.pre: Dimension (N) The permutation used to sort the contents of DLAMDA into ascending order.

param.name: indxc
param.pre: Dimension (N) The permutation used to arrange the columns of the deflated Q matrix into three groups: the first group contains non-zero elements only at and above N1, the second contains non-zero elements only below N1, and the third is dense.

param.name: indxp
param.pre: Dimension (N) The permutation used to place deflated values of D at the end of the array. INDXP(1:K) points to the nondeflated D-values and INDXP(K+1:N) points to the deflated eigenvalues.

param.name: coltyp
info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value.

para.pre: Then it tries to deflate the size of the problem. There are two ways in which deflation can occur: when two or more eigenvalues are close together or if there is a tiny entry in the Z vector. For each such occurrence the order of the related secular equation problem is reduced by one.

remarks.para: Jeff Rutter, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA \n Modified by Francoise Tisseur, University of Tennessee
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Subroutine computes the I-th eigenvalue of a symmetric rank-one modification of a 2-by-2 diagonal matrix diag( D ) + RHO * Z * transpose(Z) .

param.name: i
param.pre: The index of the eigenvalue to be computed. I = 1 or I = 2.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (2) The original eigenvalues. We assume D(1) < D(2).

param.name: z
param.pre: Dimension (2) The components of the updating vector.

param.name: delta
param.pre: Dimension (2) The vector DELTA contains the information necessary to construct the eigenvectors.

param.name: rho
param.pre: The scalar in the symmetric updating formula.

param.name: dlam
param.pre: The computed lambda_I, the I-th updated eigenvalue.

para.pre: The diagonal elements in the array D are assumed to satisfy D(i) < D(j) for i < j . We also assume RHO > 0 and that the Euclidean norm of the vector Z is one.

remarks.para: Ren-Cang Li, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Subroutine computes the I-th updated eigenvalue of a symmetric rank-one modification to a diagonal matrix whose elements are given in the array d, and that D(i) < D(j) for i < j and that RHO > 0.

param.name: n
param.pre: The length of all arrays.

param.name: i
param.pre: The index of the eigenvalue to be computed. 1 <= I <= N.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (N) The original eigenvalues. It is assumed that they are in order, D(I) < D(J) for I < J.

param.name: z
param.pre: Dimension (N) The components of the updating vector.

param.name: delta
param.pre: Dimension (N) If N > 2, DELTA contains (D(j) - lambda_I) in its j-th component. If N = 1, then DELTA(1) = 1. If N = 2, see DLAED5 for detail. The vector DELTA contains the information necessary to construct the eigenvectors by DLAED3 and DLAED9.

param.name: rho
param.pre: The scalar in the symmetric updating formula.

param.name: dlam
param.pre: The computed lambda_I, the I-th updated eigenvalue.

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit > 0: if INFO = 1, the updating process failed.

para.pre: This is arranged by the calling routine, and is no loss in generality. The rank-one modified system is thus diag( D ) + RHO * Z * Z_transpose. where we assume the Euclidean norm of Z is 1. The method consists of approximating the rational functions in the secular equation by simpler interpolating rational functions.

remarks.para: Ren-Cang Li, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Finds the roots of the secular equation, as defined by the values in D, W, and RHO, between 1 and K.

param.name: k
param.pre: The number of terms in the rational function to be solved by DLAED4. K >= 0.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of rows and columns in the Q matrix. N >= K (deflation may result in N>K).

param.name: n1
param.pre: The location of the last eigenvalue in the leading sub-matrix. min(1,N) <= N1 <= N/2.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (N) D(I) contains the updated eigenvalues for 1 <= I <= K.

param.name: q
param.pre: Dimension (LDQ,N) Initially the first K columns are used as workspace. On return the columns 1 to K contain the updated eigenvectors.
The leading dimension of the array Q. LDQ >= max(1,N).

param.name: rho
param.pre: The value of the parameter in the rank one update equation. RHO >= 0 required.

param.name: dlamda
param.pre: Dimension (K) The first K elements of this array contain the old roots of the deflated updating problem. These are the poles of the secular equation. May be changed on output by having lowest order bit set to zero on Cray X-MP, Cray Y-MP, Cray-2, or Cray C-90, as described above.

param.name: q2
param.pre: Dimension (LDQ2, N) The first K columns of this matrix contain the non-deflated eigenvectors for the split problem.

param.name: indx
param.pre: Dimension (N) The permutation used to arrange the columns of the deflated Q matrix into three groups (see DLAED2). The rows of the eigenvectors found by DLAED4 must be likewise permuted before the matrix multiply can take place.

param.name: ctot
param.pre: Dimension (4) A count of the total number of the various types of columns in Q, as described in INDX. The fourth column type is any column which has been deflated.

param.name: w
param.pre: Dimension (K) The first K elements of this array contain the components of the deflation-adjusted updating vector. Destroyed on output.

param.name: s
param.pre: Dimension (N1 + 1)*K Will contain the eigenvectors of the repaired matrix which will be multiplied by the previously accumulated eigenvectors to update the system.

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. > 0: if INFO = 1, an eigenvalue did not converge

para.pre: It makes the appropriate calls to DLAED4 and then updates the eigenvectors by multiplying the matrix of eigenvectors of the pair of eigensystems being combined by the matrix of eigenvectors of the K-by-K system which is solved here. This code makes very mild assumptions about floating point arithmetic. It will work on machines with a guard digit in add/subtract, or on those binary machines without guard digits which subtract like the Cray X-MP, Cray Y-MP, Cray C-90, or Cray-2. It could conceivably fail on hexadecimal or decimal machines without guard digits, but we know of none.

remarks.para: Jeff Rutter, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA \n Modified by Francoise Tisseur, University of Tennessee
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes the updated eigensystem of a diagonal matrix after modification by a rank-one symmetric matrix.

param.name: n
param.pre: The dimension of the symmetric tridiagonal matrix. N >= 0.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (N) On entry, the eigenvalues of the rank-1-perturbed matrix. On exit, the eigenvalues of the repaired matrix.

param.name: q
param.pre: Dimension (LDQ,N) On entry, the eigenvectors of the rank-1-perturbed matrix. On exit, the eigenvectors of the repaired tridiagonal matrix.
The leading dimension of the array Q. LDQ >= max(1,N).

param.name: indxq
param.pre: Dimension (N) On entry, the permutation which separately sorts the two subproblems in D into ascending order. On exit, the permutation which will reintegrate the subproblems back into sorted order, i.e. D( INDXQ( I = 1, N ) ) will be in ascending order.

param.name: rho
param.pre: The sub-diagonal entry used to create the rank-1 modification.

param.name: cutpnt
param.pre: The location of the last eigenvalue in the leading sub-matrix. min(1,N) <= CUTPNT <= N/2.

param.name: work
param.pre: Dimension (4*N + N**2)

param.name: iwork
param.pre: Dimension (4*N)

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. > 0: if INFO = 1, an eigenvalue did not converge

para.pre: This routine is used only for the eigenproblem which requires all eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a tridiagonal matrix. DLAED7 handles the case in which eigenvalues only or eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a full symmetric matrix (which was reduced to tridiagonal form) are desired. T = Q(in) ( D(in) + RHO * Z*ZT ) QT(in) = Q(out) * D(out) * QT(out) where Z = QT*u, u is a vector of length N with ones in the CUTPNT and CUTPNT + 1 th elements and zeros elsewhere. The eigenvectors of the original matrix are stored in Q, and the eigenvalues are in D. The algorithm consists of three stages: The first stage consists of deflating the size of the problem when there are multiple eigenvalues or if there is a zero in the Z vector. For each such occurence the dimension of the secular equation problem is reduced by one. This stage is performed by the routine DLAED2. The second stage consists of calculating the updated eigenvalues. This is done by finding the roots of the secular equation via the routine DLAED4 (as called by DLAED3). This routine also calculates the eigenvectors of the current problem. The final stage consists of computing the updated eigenvectors directly using the updated eigenvalues. The eigenvectors for the current problem are multiplied with the eigenvectors from the overall problem.

remarks.para: Jeff Rutter, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA \n Modified by Francoise Tisseur, University of Tennessee
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Merges the two sets of eigenvalues together into a single sorted set.

param.name: icompq
param.pre: = 0: Compute eigenvalues only. = 1: Compute eigenvectors of original dense symmetric matrix also. On entry, Q contains the orthogonal matrix used to reduce the original matrix to tridiagonal form.

param.name: k
param.pre: The number of non-deflated eigenvalues, and the order of the related secular equation.

param.name: n
param.pre: The dimension of the symmetric tridiagonal matrix. N >= 0.

param.name: qsiz
param.pre: The dimension of the orthogonal matrix used to reduce the full matrix to tridiagonal form. QSIZ >= N if ICOMPQ = 1.

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (N) On entry, the eigenvalues of the two submatrices to be combined. On exit, the trailing (N-K) updated eigenvalues (those which were deflated) sorted into increasing order.

param.name: q
param.pre: Dimension (LDQ,N) If ICOMPQ = 0, Q is not referenced. Otherwise, on entry, Q contains the eigenvectors of the partially solved system which has been previously updated in matrix multiplies with other partially solved eigensystems. On exit, Q contains the trailing (N-K) updated eigenvectors (those which were deflated) in its last N-K columns.
The leading dimension of the array Q. LDQ >= max(1,N).

param.name: indxq
param.pre: Dimension (N) The permutation which separately sorts the two sub-problems in D into ascending order. Note that elements in the second half of this permutation must first have CUTPNT added to their values in order to be accurate.

param.name: rho
param.pre: On entry, the off-diagonal element associated with the rank-1 cut which originally split the two submatrices which are now being recombined. On exit, RHO has been modified to the value required by DLAED3.

param.name: cutpnt
param.pre: The location of the last eigenvalue in the leading sub-matrix. min(1,N) <= CUTPNT <= N.

param.name: z
param.pre: Dimension (N) On entry, Z contains the updating vector (the last row of the first sub-eigenvector matrix and the first row of the second sub-eigenvector matrix). On exit, the contents of Z are destroyed by the updating process.

param.name: dlamda
param.pre: Dimension (N) A copy of the first K eigenvalues which will be used by DLAED3 to form the secular equation.

param.name: q2
param.pre: Dimension (LDQ2,N) If ICOMPQ = 0, Q2 is not referenced. Otherwise, a copy of the first K eigenvectors which will be used by DLAED7 in a matrix multiply (DGEMM) to update the new eigenvectors.
The leading dimension of the array Q2. LDQ2 >= max(1,N).

param.name: w
param.pre: Dimension (N) The first k values of the final deflation-altered z-vector and will be passed to DLAED3.

param.name: perm
param.pre: Dimension (N) The permutations (from deflation and sorting) to be applied to each eigenblock.

param.name: givptr
param.pre: The number of Givens rotations which took place in this subproblem.

param.name: givcol
param.pre: Dimension (2, N) Each pair of numbers indicates a pair of columns to take place in a Givens rotation.

param.name: givnum
param.pre: Dimension (2, N) Each number indicates the S value to be used in the corresponding Givens rotation.

param.name: indxp
param.pre: Dimension (N) The permutation used to place deflated values of D at the end of the array. INDXP(1:K) points to the nondeflated D-values and INDXP(K+1:N) points to the deflated eigenvalues.

param.name: indx
param.pre: Dimension (N) The permutation used to sort the contents of D into ascending order.

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value.

para.pre: Then it tries to deflate the size of the problem. There are two ways in which deflation can occur: when two or more eigenvalues are close together or if there is a tiny element in the Z vector. For each such occurrence the order of the related secular equation problem is reduced by one.

remarks.para: Jeff Rutter, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Finds the roots of the secular equation, as defined by the values in D, Z, and RHO, between KSTART and KSTOP.

param.name: k
param.pre: The number of terms in the rational function to be solved by DLAED4. K >= 0.

param.name: kstop
param.pre: The updated eigenvalues Lambda(I), KSTART <= I <= KSTOP are to be computed. 1 <= KSTART <= KSTOP <= K.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of rows and columns in the Q matrix. N >= K (delation may result in N > K).

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (N) D(I) contains the updated eigenvalues for KSTART <= I <= KSTOP.

param.name: q
param.pre: Dimension (LDQ,N)
The leading dimension of the array Q. LDQ >= max( 1, N ).

param.name: rho
param.pre: The value of the parameter in the rank one update equation. RHO >= 0 required.

param.name: dlamda
param.pre: Dimension (K) The first K elements of this array contain the old roots of the deflated updating problem. These are the poles of the secular equation.

param.name: w
param.pre: Dimension (K) The first K elements of this array contain the components of the deflation-adjusted updating vector.

param.name: s
param.pre: Dimension (LDS, K) Will contain the eigenvectors of the repaired matrix which will be stored for subsequent Z vector calculation and multiplied by the previously accumulated eigenvectors to update the system.
The leading dimension of S. LDS >= max( 1, K ).

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. > 0: if INFO = 1, an eigenvalue did not converge

para.pre: It makes the appropriate calls to DLAED4 and then stores the new matrix of eigenvectors for use in calculating the next level of Z vectors.

remarks.para: Jeff Rutter, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes the Z vector corresponding to the merge step in the CURLVLth step of the merge process with TLVLS steps for the CURPBMth problem.

param.name: n
param.pre: The dimension of the symmetric tridiagonal matrix. N >= 0.

param.name: tlvls
param.pre: The total number of merging levels in the overall divide and conquer tree.

param.name: curlvl
param.pre: The current level in the overall merge routine, 0 <= curlvl <= tlvls.

param.name: curpbm
param.pre: The current problem in the current level in the overall merge routine (counting from upper left to lower right).

param.name: prmptr
param.pre: Dimension (N lg N) Contains a list of pointers which indicate where in PERM a level's permutation is stored. PRMPTR(i+1) - PRMPTR(i) indicates the size of the permutation and incidentally the size of the full, non-deflated problem.

param.name: perm
param.pre: Dimension (N lg N) Contains the permutations (from deflation and sorting) to be applied to each eigenblock.

param.name: givptr
param.pre: Dimension (N lg N) Contains a list of pointers which indicate where in GIVCOL a level's Givens rotations are stored. GIVPTR(i+1) - GIVPTR(i) indicates the number of Givens rotations.

param.name: givcol
param.pre: Dimension (2, N lg N) Each pair of numbers indicates a pair of columns to take place in a Givens rotation.

param.name: givnum
param.pre: Dimension (2, N lg N) Each number indicates the S value to be used in the corresponding Givens rotation.

param.name: q
param.pre: Dimension (N**2) Contains the square eigenblocks from previous levels, the starting positions for blocks are given by QPTR.

param.name: qptr
param.pre: Dimension (N+2) Contains a list of pointers which indicate where in Q an eigenblock is stored. SQRT( QPTR(i+1) - QPTR(i) ) indicates the size of the block.

param.name: z
param.pre: Dimension (N) On return this vector contains the updating vector (the last row of the first sub-eigenvector matrix and the first row of the second sub-eigenvector matrix).

param.name: ztemp
param.pre: Dimension (N)

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value.

remarks.para: Jeff Rutter, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA
Authors: Univ. of Tennessee, Univ. of California Berkeley, Univ. of Colorado Denver, NAG Ltd.
Date: September 2012

summary.para: Computes the updated eigensystem of a diagonal matrix after modification by a rank-one symmetric matrix.

param.name: icompq
param.pre: = 0: Compute eigenvalues only. = 1: Compute eigenvectors of original dense symmetric matrix also. On entry, Q contains the orthogonal matrix used to reduce the original matrix to tridiagonal form.

param.name: n
param.pre: The dimension of the symmetric tridiagonal matrix. N >= 0.

param.name: qsiz
param.pre: The dimension of the orthogonal matrix used to reduce the full matrix to tridiagonal form. QSIZ >= N if ICOMPQ = 1.

param.name: tlvls
param.pre: The total number of merging levels in the overall divide and conquer tree.

param.name: curlvl
param.pre: The current level in the overall merge routine, 0 <= CURLVL <= TLVLS.

param.name: curpbm
param.pre: The current problem in the current level in the overall merge routine (counting from upper left to lower right).

param.name: d
param.pre: Dimension (N) On entry, the eigenvalues of the rank-1-perturbed matrix. On exit, the eigenvalues of the repaired matrix.

param.name: q
param.pre: Dimension (LDQ, N) On entry, the eigenvectors of the rank-1-perturbed matrix. On exit, the eigenvectors of the repaired tridiagonal matrix.
The leading dimension of the array Q. LDQ >= max(1,N).

param.name: indxq
param.pre: Dimension (N) The permutation which will reintegrate the subproblem just solved back into sorted order, i.e., D( INDXQ( I = 1, N ) ) will be in ascending order.

param.name: rho
param.pre: The sub-diagonal element used to create the rank-1 modification.

param.name: cutpnt
param.pre: Contains the location of the last eigenvalue in the leading sub-matrix. min(1,N) <= CUTPNT <= N.

param.name: qstore
param.pre: Dimension (N**2+1) Stores eigenvectors of submatrices encountered during divide and conquer, packed together. QPTR points to beginning of the submatrices.

param.name: qptr
param.pre: Dimension (N+2) List of indices pointing to beginning of submatrices stored in QSTORE. The submatrices are numbered starting at the bottom left of the divide and conquer tree, from left to right and bottom to top.

param.name: prmptr
param.pre: Dimension (N lg N) Contains a list of pointers which indicate where in PERM a level's permutation is stored. PRMPTR(i+1) - PRMPTR(i) indicates the size of the permutation and also the size of the full, non-deflated problem.

param.name: perm
param.pre: Dimension (N lg N) Contains the permutations (from deflation and sorting) to be applied to each eigenblock.

param.name: givptr
param.pre: Dimension (N lg N) Contains a list of pointers which indicate where in GIVCOL a level's Givens rotations are stored. GIVPTR(i+1) - GIVPTR(i) indicates the number of Givens rotations.

param.name: givcol
param.pre: Dimension (2, N lg N) Each pair of numbers indicates a pair of columns to take place in a Givens rotation.

param.name: givnum
param.pre: Dimension (2, N lg N) Each number indicates the S value to be used in the corresponding Givens rotation.

param.name: work
param.pre: Dimension (3*N+2*QSIZ*N)

param.name: iwork
param.pre: Dimension (4*N)

param.name: info
param.pre: = 0: successful exit. < 0: if INFO = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. > 0: if INFO = 1, an eigenvalue did not converge

para.pre: This routine is used only for the eigenproblem which requires all eigenvalues and optionally eigenvectors of a dense symmetric matrix that has been reduced to tridiagonal form.
