summary.para: Computes an LU factorization of a general M-by-N matrix A using partial pivoting with row interchanges.

param.name: m
param.pre: The number of rows of the matrix A. M >= 0.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the M-by-N matrix to be factored. On exit, the factors L and U from the factorization A = P*L*U; the unit diagonal elements of L are not stored.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,M).

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (min(M,N)) The pivot indices; for 1 <= i <= min(M,N), row i of the matrix was interchanged with row IPIV(i).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i, U(i,i) is exactly zero. The factorization has been completed, but the factor U is exactly singular, and division by zero will occur if it is used to solve a system of equations.

para.pre: The factorization has the form A = P * L * U where P is a permutation matrix, L is lower triangular with unit diagonal elements (lower trapezoidal if m > n), and U is upper triangular (upper trapezoidal if m < n). This is the right-looking Level 3 BLAS version of the algorithm.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DGETRF.

summary.para: Solves a system of linear equations A * X = B or AT * X = B with a general N-by-N matrix A using the LU factorization computed by DGETRF.

param.name: trans
param.pre: Specifies the form of the system of equations: = 'N': A * X = B (No transpose) = 'T': AT* X = B (Transpose) = 'C': AT* X = B (Conjugate transpose = Transpose)

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: nrhs
param.pre: The number of right hand sides, i.e., the number of columns of the matrix B. NRHS >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) The factors L and U from the factorization A = P*L*U as computed by DGETRF.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (N) The pivot indices from DGETRF; for 1<=i<=N, row i of the matrix was interchanged with row IPIV(i).

param.name: b
param.pre: Dimension (LDB,NRHS) On entry, the right hand side matrix B. On exit, the solution matrix X.
The leading dimension of the array B. LDB >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DGETRS.

summary.para: Computes the inverse of a matrix using the LU factorization computed by DGETRF.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the factors L and U from the factorization A = P*L*U as computed by DGETRF. On exit, if = 0, the inverse of the original matrix A.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (N) The pivot indices from DGETRF; for 1<=i<=N, row i of the matrix was interchanged with row IPIV(i).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i, U(i,i) is exactly zero; the matrix is singular and its inverse could not be computed.

para.pre: This method inverts U and then computes inv(A) by solving the system inv(A)*L = inv(U) for inv(A).

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DGETRI.

summary.para: Estimates the reciprocal of the condition number of a general real matrix A, in either the 1-norm or the infinity-norm, using the LU factorization computed by DGETRF.

param.name: norm
param.pre: Specifies whether the 1-norm condition number or the infinity-norm condition number is required: = '1' or 'O': 1-norm; = 'I': Infinity-norm.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) The factors L and U from the factorization A = P*L*U as computed by DGETRF.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: anorm
param.pre: If NORM = '1' or 'O', the 1-norm of the original matrix A. If NORM = 'I', the infinity-norm of the original matrix A.

param.name: rcond
param.pre: The reciprocal of the condition number of the matrix A, computed as RCOND = 1/(norm(A) * norm(inv(A))).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

para.pre: An estimate is obtained for norm(inv(A)), and the reciprocal of the condition number is computed as RCOND = 1 / ( norm(A) * norm(inv(A)) ).

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DGECON.

summary.para: Computes a QR factorization of a real M-by-N matrix A: A = Q * R.

param.name: m
param.pre: The number of rows of the matrix A. M >= 0.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the M-by-N matrix A. On exit, the elements on and above the diagonal of the array contain the min(M,N)-by-N upper trapezoidal matrix R (R is upper triangular if m >= n); the elements below the diagonal, with the array TAU, represent the orthogonal matrix Q as a product of min(m,n) elementary reflectors (see Further Details).
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,M).

param.name: tau
param.pre: Dimension (min(M,N)) The scalar factors of the elementary reflectors (see Further Details).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

para.pre: The matrix Q is represented as a product of elementary reflectors Q = H(1) H(2) . . . H(k), where k = min(m,n). Each H(i) has the form H(i) = I - tau * v * vT where tau is a real scalar, and v is a real vector with v(1:i-1) = 0 and v(i) = 1; v(i+1:m) is stored on exit in A(i+1:m,i), and tau in TAU(i).

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DGEQRF.

summary.para: Computes a QR factorization with column pivoting of a matrix A: A*P = Q*R using Level 3 BLAS.

param.name: m
param.pre: The number of rows of the matrix A. M >= 0.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the M-by-N matrix A. On exit, the upper triangle of the array contains the min(M,N)-by-N upper trapezoidal matrix R; the elements below the diagonal, together with the array TAU, represent the orthogonal matrix Q as a product of min(M,N) elementary reflectors.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,M).

param.name: jpvt
param.pre: Dimension (N) On entry, if JPVT(J).ne.0, the J-th column of A is permuted to the front of A*P (a leading column); if JPVT(J)=0, the J-th column of A is a free column. On exit, if JPVT(J)=K, then the J-th column of A*P was the the K-th column of A.

param.name: tau
param.pre: Dimension (min(M,N)) The scalar factors of the elementary reflectors.

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit. < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value.

para.pre: The matrix Q is represented as a product of elementary reflectors Q = H(1) H(2) . . . H(k), where k = min(m,n). Each H(i) has the form H(i) = I - tau * v * vT where tau is a real/complex scalar, and v is a real/complex vector with v(1:i-1) = 0 and v(i) = 1; v(i+1:m) is stored on exit in A(i+1:m,i), and tau in TAU(i).

remarks.para: G. Quintana-Orti, Depto. de Informatica, Universidad Jaime I, Spain X. Sun, Computer Science Dept., Duke University, USA
This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DGEQP3.

summary.para: Overwrites the general real M-by-N matrix C with SIDE = 'L' SIDE = 'R' TRANS = 'N': Q * C C * Q TRANS = 'T': QT * C C * QT where Q is a real orthogonal matrix defined as the product of k elementary reflectors Q = H(1) H(2) .

param.name: side
param.pre: = 'L': apply Q or QT from the Left; = 'R': apply Q or QT from the Right.

param.name: trans
param.pre: = 'N': No transpose, apply Q; = 'T': Transpose, apply QT.

param.name: m
param.pre: The number of rows of the matrix C. M >= 0.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns of the matrix C. N >= 0.

param.name: k
param.pre: The number of elementary reflectors whose product defines the matrix Q. If SIDE = 'L', M >= K >= 0; if SIDE = 'R', N >= K >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,K) The i-th column must contain the vector which defines the elementary reflector H(i), for i = 1,2,...,k, as returned by DGEQRF in the first k columns of its array argument A. A is modified by the routine but restored on exit.

param.name: tau
param.pre: Dimension (K) TAU(i) must contain the scalar factor of the elementary reflector H(i), as returned by DGEQRF.

param.name: c
param.pre: Dimension (LDC,N) On entry, the M-by-N matrix C. On exit, C is overwritten by Q*C or QT*C or C*QT or C*Q.
The leading dimension of the array C. LDC >= max(1,M).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

para.pre: . . H(k) as returned by DGEQRF. Q is of order M if SIDE = 'L' and of order N if SIDE = 'R'.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DORMQR.

summary.para: Computes the factorization of a real symmetric matrix A using the Bunch-Kaufman diagonal pivoting method.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': Upper triangle of A is stored; = 'L': Lower triangle of A is stored.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the symmetric matrix A. If UPLO = 'U', the leading N-by-N upper triangular part of A contains the upper triangular part of the matrix A, and the strictly lower triangular part of A is not referenced. If UPLO = 'L', the leading N-by-N lower triangular part of A contains the lower triangular part of the matrix A, and the strictly upper triangular part of A is not referenced. On exit, the block diagonal matrix D and the multipliers used to obtain the factor U or L (see below for further details).
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (N) Details of the interchanges and the block structure of D. If IPIV(k) > 0, then rows and columns k and IPIV(k) were interchanged and D(k,k) is a 1-by-1 diagonal block. If UPLO = 'U' and IPIV(k) = IPIV(k-1) < 0, then rows and columns k-1 and -IPIV(k) were interchanged and D(k-1:k,k-1:k) is a 2-by-2 diagonal block. If UPLO = 'L' and IPIV(k) = IPIV(k+1) < 0, then rows and columns k+1 and -IPIV(k) were interchanged and D(k:k+1,k:k+1) is a 2-by-2 diagonal block.

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i, D(i,i) is exactly zero. The factorization has been completed, but the block diagonal matrix D is exactly singular, and division by zero will occur if it is used to solve a system of equations.

para.pre: The form of the factorization is A = U*D*UT or A = L*D*LT where U (or L) is a product of permutation and unit upper (lower) triangular matrices, and D is symmetric and block diagonal with 1-by-1 and 2-by-2 diagonal blocks. This is the blocked version of the algorithm, calling Level 3 BLAS.

If UPLO = 'U', then A = U*D*UT, where U = P(n)*U(n)* ... *P(k)U(k)* ..., i.e., U is a product of terms P(k)*U(k), where k decreases from n to 1 in steps of 1 or 2, and D is a block diagonal matrix with 1-by-1 and 2-by-2 diagonal blocks D(k). P(k) is a permutation matrix as defined by IPIV(k), and U(k) is a unit upper triangular matrix, such that if the diagonal block D(k) is of order s (s = 1 or 2), then ( I v 0 ) k-s U(k) = ( 0 I 0 ) s ( 0 0 I ) n-k k-s s n-k If s = 1, D(k) overwrites A(k,k), and v overwrites A(1:k-1,k). If s = 2, the upper triangle of D(k) overwrites A(k-1,k-1), A(k-1,k), and A(k,k), and v overwrites A(1:k-2,k-1:k). If UPLO = 'L', then A = L*D*LT, where L = P(1)*L(1)* ... *P(k)*L(k)* ..., i.e., L is a product of terms P(k)*L(k), where k increases from 1 to n in steps of 1 or 2, and D is a block diagonal matrix with 1-by-1 and 2-by-2 diagonal blocks D(k). P(k) is a permutation matrix as defined by IPIV(k), and L(k) is a unit lower triangular matrix, such that if the diagonal block D(k) is of order s (s = 1 or 2), then ( I 0 0 ) k-1 L(k) = ( 0 I 0 ) s ( 0 v I ) n-k-s+1 k-1 s n-k-s+1 If s = 1, D(k) overwrites A(k,k), and v overwrites A(k+1:n,k). If s = 2, the lower triangle of D(k) overwrites A(k,k), A(k+1,k), and A(k+1,k+1), and v overwrites A(k+2:n,k:k+1).

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DSYTRF.

summary.para: Solves a system of linear equations A*X = B with a real symmetric matrix A using the factorization A = U*D*UT or A = L*D*LT computed by DSYTRF.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: Specifies whether the details of the factorization are stored as an upper or lower triangular matrix. = 'U': Upper triangular, form is A = U*D*UT; = 'L': Lower triangular, form is A = L*D*LT.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: nrhs
param.pre: The number of right hand sides, i.e., the number of columns of the matrix B. NRHS >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) The block diagonal matrix D and the multipliers used to obtain the factor U or L as computed by DSYTRF.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (N) Details of the interchanges and the block structure of D as determined by DSYTRF.

param.name: b
param.pre: Dimension (LDB,NRHS) On entry, the right hand side matrix B. On exit, the solution matrix X.
The leading dimension of the array B. LDB >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DSYTRS.

summary.para: Computes the inverse of a real symmetric indefinite matrix A using the factorization A = U*D*UT or A = L*D*LT computed by DSYTRF.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: Specifies whether the details of the factorization are stored as an upper or lower triangular matrix. = 'U': Upper triangular, form is A = U*D*UT; = 'L': Lower triangular, form is A = L*D*LT.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the block diagonal matrix D and the multipliers used to obtain the factor U or L as computed by DSYTRF. On exit, if = 0, the (symmetric) inverse of the original matrix. If UPLO = 'U', the upper triangular part of the inverse is formed and the part of A below the diagonal is not referenced; if UPLO = 'L' the lower triangular part of the inverse is formed and the part of A above the diagonal is not referenced.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (N) Details of the interchanges and the block structure of D as determined by DSYTRF.

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i, D(i,i) = 0; the matrix is singular and its inverse could not be computed.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DSYTRI.

summary.para: Estimates the reciprocal of the condition number (in the 1-norm) of a real symmetric matrix A using the factorization A = U*D*UT or A = L*D*LT computed by DSYTRF.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: Specifies whether the details of the factorization are stored as an upper or lower triangular matrix. = 'U': Upper triangular, form is A = U*D*UT; = 'L': Lower triangular, form is A = L*D*LT.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) The block diagonal matrix D and the multipliers used to obtain the factor U or L as computed by DSYTRF.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (N) Details of the interchanges and the block structure of D as determined by DSYTRF.

param.name: anorm
param.pre: The 1-norm of the original matrix A.

param.name: rcond
param.pre: The reciprocal of the condition number of the matrix A, computed as RCOND = 1/(ANORM * AINVNM), where AINVNM is an estimate of the 1-norm of inv(A) computed in this routine.

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

para.pre: An estimate is obtained for norm(inv(A)), and the reciprocal of the condition number is computed as RCOND = 1 / (ANORM * norm(inv(A))).

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DSYCON.

summary.para: Computes the inverse of a real upper or lower triangular matrix A.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': A is upper triangular; = 'L': A is lower triangular.

param.name: diag
param.pre: = 'N': A is non-unit triangular; = 'U': A is unit triangular.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the triangular matrix A. If UPLO = 'U', the leading N-by-N upper triangular part of the array A contains the upper triangular matrix, and the strictly lower triangular part of A is not referenced. If UPLO = 'L', the leading N-by-N lower triangular part of the array A contains the lower triangular matrix, and the strictly upper triangular part of A is not referenced. If DIAG = 'U', the diagonal elements of A are also not referenced and are assumed to be 1. On exit, the (triangular) inverse of the original matrix, in the same storage format.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i, A(i,i) is exactly zero. The triangular matrix is singular and its inverse can not be computed.

para.pre: This is the Level 3 BLAS version of the algorithm.

summary.para: Solves a triangular system of the form A * X = B or AT * X = B, where A is a triangular matrix of order N, and B is an N-by-NRHS matrix.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': A is upper triangular; = 'L': A is lower triangular.

param.name: trans
param.pre: Specifies the form of the system of equations: = 'N': A * X = B (No transpose) = 'T': AT * X = B (Transpose) = 'C': AH * X = B (Conjugate transpose = Transpose)

param.name: diag
param.pre: = 'N': A is non-unit triangular; = 'U': A is unit triangular.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: nrhs
param.pre: The number of right hand sides, i.e., the number of columns of the matrix B. NRHS >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) The triangular matrix A. If UPLO = 'U', the leading N-by-N upper triangular part of the array A contains the upper triangular matrix, and the strictly lower triangular part of A is not referenced. If UPLO = 'L', the leading N-by-N lower triangular part of the array A contains the lower triangular matrix, and the strictly upper triangular part of A is not referenced. If DIAG = 'U', the diagonal elements of A are also not referenced and are assumed to be 1.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: b
param.pre: Dimension (LDB,NRHS) On entry, the right hand side matrix B. On exit, if = 0, the solution matrix X.
The leading dimension of the array B. LDB >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i, the i-th diagonal element of A is zero, indicating that the matrix is singular and the solutions X have not been computed.

para.pre: A check is made to verify that A is nonsingular.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DTRTRS.

summary.para: Estimates the reciprocal of the condition number of a triangular matrix A, in either the 1-norm or the infinity-norm.

param.name: norm
param.pre: Specifies whether the 1-norm condition number or the infinity-norm condition number is required: = '1' or 'O': 1-norm; = 'I': Infinity-norm.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': A is upper triangular; = 'L': A is lower triangular.

param.name: diag
param.pre: = 'N': A is non-unit triangular; = 'U': A is unit triangular.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) The triangular matrix A. If UPLO = 'U', the leading N-by-N upper triangular part of the array A contains the upper triangular matrix, and the strictly lower triangular part of A is not referenced. If UPLO = 'L', the leading N-by-N lower triangular part of the array A contains the lower triangular matrix, and the strictly upper triangular part of A is not referenced. If DIAG = 'U', the diagonal elements of A are also not referenced and are assumed to be 1.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: rcond
param.pre: The reciprocal of the condition number of the matrix A, computed as RCOND = 1/(norm(A) * norm(inv(A))).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

para.pre: The norm of A is computed and an estimate is obtained for norm(inv(A)), then the reciprocal of the condition number is computed as RCOND = 1 / ( norm(A) * norm(inv(A)) ).

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DTRCON.

summary.para: Estimates the reciprocal of the condition number (in the 1-norm) of a real symmetric positive definite matrix using the Cholesky factorization A = UT*U or A = L*LT computed by DPOTRF.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': Upper triangle of A is stored; = 'L': Lower triangle of A is stored.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) The triangular factor U or L from the Cholesky factorization A = UT*U or A = L*LT, as computed by DPOTRF.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: anorm
param.pre: The 1-norm (or infinity-norm) of the symmetric matrix A.

param.name: rcond
param.pre: The reciprocal of the condition number of the matrix A, computed as RCOND = 1/(ANORM * AINVNM), where AINVNM is an estimate of the 1-norm of inv(A) computed in this routine.

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

para.pre: An estimate is obtained for norm(inv(A)), and the reciprocal of the condition number is computed as RCOND = 1 / (ANORM * norm(inv(A))).

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DPOCON.

summary.para: Computes the Cholesky factorization of a real symmetric positive definite matrix A.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': Upper triangle of A is stored; = 'L': Lower triangle of A is stored.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the symmetric matrix A. If UPLO = 'U', the leading N-by-N upper triangular part of A contains the upper triangular part of the matrix A, and the strictly lower triangular part of A is not referenced. If UPLO = 'L', the leading N-by-N lower triangular part of A contains the lower triangular part of the matrix A, and the strictly upper triangular part of A is not referenced. On exit, if = 0, the factor U or L from the Cholesky factorization A = UT*U or A = L*LT.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i, the leading minor of order i is not positive definite, and the factorization could not be completed.

para.pre: The factorization has the form A = UT * U, if UPLO = 'U', or A = L * LT, if UPLO = 'L', where U is an upper triangular matrix and L is lower triangular. This is the block version of the algorithm, calling Level 3 BLAS.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DPOTRF.

summary.para: Computes the inverse of a real symmetric positive definite matrix A using the Cholesky factorization A = UT*U or A = L*LT computed by DPOTRF.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': Upper triangle of A is stored; = 'L': Lower triangle of A is stored.

param.name: n

param.name: a

The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i, the (i,i) element of the factor U or L is zero, and the inverse could not be computed.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DPOTRI.

The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

The leading dimension of the array B. LDB >= max(1,N).

summary.para: Computes the singular value decomposition (SVD) of a real M-by-N matrix A, optionally computing the left and right singular vectors.

param.name: jobz
m
param.pre: The number of rows of the input matrix A. M >= 0.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns of the input matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the M-by-N matrix A. On exit, if JOBZ = 'O', A is overwritten with the first N columns of U (the left singular vectors, stored columnwise) if M >= N; A is overwritten with the first M rows of VT (the right singular vectors, stored rowwise) otherwise. if JOBZ .ne. 'O', the contents of A are destroyed.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,M).

param.name: s
param.pre: Dimension (min(M,N)) The singular values of A, sorted so that S(i) >= S(i+1).

param.name: u
param.pre: The leading dimension of the array U. LDU >= 1; if JOBZ = 'S' or 'A' or JOBZ = 'O' and M < N, LDU >= M.

param.name: vt
info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit. < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. > 0: DBDSDC did not converge, updating process failed.

para.pre: If singular vectors are desired, it uses a divide-and-conquer algorithm. The SVD is written A = U * SIGMA * transpose(V) where SIGMA is an M-by-N matrix which is zero except for its min(m,n) diagonal elements, U is an M-by-M orthogonal matrix, and V is an N-by-N orthogonal matrix. The diagonal elements of SIGMA are the singular values of A; they are real and non-negative, and are returned in descending order. The first min(m,n) columns of U and V are the left and right singular vectors of A. Note that the routine returns VT = VT, not V. The divide and conquer algorithm makes very mild assumptions about floating point arithmetic. It will work on machines with a guard digit in add/subtract, or on those binary machines without guard digits which subtract like the Cray X-MP, Cray Y-MP, Cray C-90, or Cray-2. It could conceivably fail on hexadecimal or decimal machines without guard digits, but we know of none.

remarks.para: Ming Gu and Huan Ren, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA

summary.para: Computes an LU factorization of a real m-by-n band matrix A using partial pivoting with row interchanges.

param.name: m
param.pre: The number of rows of the matrix A. M >= 0.

param.name: n
param.pre: The number of columns of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: kl
param.pre: The number of subdiagonals within the band of A. KL >= 0.

param.name: ku
param.pre: The number of superdiagonals within the band of A. KU >= 0.

param.name: ab
param.pre: Dimension (LDAB,N) On entry, the matrix A in band storage, in rows KL+1 to 2*KL+KU+1; rows 1 to KL of the array need not be set. The j-th column of A is stored in the j-th column of the array AB as follows: AB(kl+ku+1+i-j,j) = A(i,j) for max(1,j-ku)<=i<=min(m,j+kl) On exit, details of the factorization: U is stored as an upper triangular band matrix with KL+KU superdiagonals in rows 1 to KL+KU+1, and the multipliers used during the factorization are stored in rows KL+KU+2 to 2*KL+KU+1. See below for further details.
The leading dimension of the array AB. LDAB >= 2*KL+KU+1.

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (min(M,N)) The pivot indices; for 1 <= i <= min(M,N), row i of the matrix was interchanged with row IPIV(i).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = +i, U(i,i) is exactly zero. The factorization has been completed, but the factor U is exactly singular, and division by zero will occur if it is used to solve a system of equations.

para.pre: This is the blocked version of the algorithm, calling Level 3 BLAS.

The band storage scheme is illustrated by the following example, when M = N = 6, KL = 2, KU = 1: On entry: On exit: * * * + + + * * * u14 u25 u36 * * + + + + * * u13 u24 u35 u46 * a12 a23 a34 a45 a56 * u12 u23 u34 u45 u56 a11 a22 a33 a44 a55 a66 u11 u22 u33 u44 u55 u66 a21 a32 a43 a54 a65 * m21 m32 m43 m54 m65 * a31 a42 a53 a64 * * m31 m42 m53 m64 * * Array elements marked * are not used by the routine; elements marked + need not be set on entry, but are required by the routine to store elements of U because of fill-in resulting from the row interchanges.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine ?GBTRF.

summary.para: Solves a system of linear equations A * X = B or AT * X = B with a general band matrix A using the LU factorization computed by DGBTRF.

param.name: trans
param.pre: Specifies the form of the system of equations. = 'N': A * X = B (No transpose) = 'T': AT* X = B (Transpose) = 'C': AT* X = B (Conjugate transpose = Transpose)

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: kl
param.pre: The number of subdiagonals within the band of A. KL >= 0.

param.name: ku
param.pre: The number of superdiagonals within the band of A. KU >= 0.

param.name: nrhs
param.pre: The number of right hand sides, i.e., the number of columns of the matrix B. NRHS >= 0.

param.name: ab
param.pre: Dimension (LDAB,N) Details of the LU factorization of the band matrix A, as computed by DGBTRF. U is stored as an upper triangular band matrix with KL+KU superdiagonals in rows 1 to KL+KU+1, and the multipliers used during the factorization are stored in rows KL+KU+2 to 2*KL+KU+1.
The leading dimension of the array AB. LDAB >= 2*KL+KU+1.

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (N) The pivot indices; for 1 <= i <= N, row i of the matrix was interchanged with row IPIV(i).

param.name: b
param.pre: Dimension (LDB,NRHS) On entry, the right hand side matrix B. On exit, the solution matrix X.
The leading dimension of the array B. LDB >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DGBTRS.

summary.para: Estimates the reciprocal of the condition number of a real general band matrix A, in either the 1-norm or the infinity-norm, using the LU factorization computed by DGBTRF.

param.name: norm
param.pre: Specifies whether the 1-norm condition number or the infinity-norm condition number is required: = '1' or 'O': 1-norm; = 'I': Infinity-norm.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: kl
param.pre: The number of subdiagonals within the band of A. KL >= 0.

param.name: ku
param.pre: The number of superdiagonals within the band of A. KU >= 0.

param.name: ab
param.pre: Dimension (LDAB,N) Details of the LU factorization of the band matrix A, as computed by DGBTRF. U is stored as an upper triangular band matrix with KL+KU superdiagonals in rows 1 to KL+KU+1, and the multipliers used during the factorization are stored in rows KL+KU+2 to 2*KL+KU+1.
The leading dimension of the array AB. LDAB >= 2*KL+KU+1.

param.name: ipiv
param.pre: Dimension (N) The pivot indices; for 1 <= i <= N, row i of the matrix was interchanged with row IPIV(i).

param.name: anorm
param.pre: If NORM = '1' or 'O', the 1-norm of the original matrix A. If NORM = 'I', the infinity-norm of the original matrix A.

param.name: rcond
param.pre: The reciprocal of the condition number of the matrix A, computed as RCOND = 1/(norm(A) * norm(inv(A))).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

para.pre: An estimate is obtained for norm(inv(A)), and the reciprocal of the condition number is computed as RCOND = 1 / ( norm(A) * norm(inv(A)) ).

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DGBCON.

summary.para: Solves a triangular system of the form A * X = B or AT * X = B, where A is a triangular band matrix of order N, and B is an N-by NRHS matrix.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': A is upper triangular; = 'L': A is lower triangular.

param.name: trans
param.pre: Specifies the form the system of equations: = 'N': A * X = B (No transpose) = 'T': AT * X = B (Transpose) = 'C': AH * X = B (Conjugate transpose = Transpose)

param.name: diag
param.pre: = 'N': A is non-unit triangular; = 'U': A is unit triangular.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: kd
param.pre: The number of superdiagonals or subdiagonals of the triangular band matrix A. KD >= 0.

param.name: nrhs
param.pre: The number of right hand sides, i.e., the number of columns of the matrix B. NRHS >= 0.

param.name: ab
param.pre: Dimension (LDAB,N) The upper or lower triangular band matrix A, stored in the first kd+1 rows of AB. The j-th column of A is stored in the j-th column of the array AB as follows: if UPLO = 'U', AB(kd+1+i-j,j) = A(i,j) for max(1,j-kd)<=i<=j; if UPLO = 'L', AB(1+i-j,j) = A(i,j) for j<=i<=min(n,j+kd). If DIAG = 'U', the diagonal elements of A are not referenced and are assumed to be 1.
The leading dimension of the array AB. LDAB >= KD+1.

param.name: b
param.pre: Dimension (LDB,NRHS) On entry, the right hand side matrix B. On exit, if = 0, the solution matrix X.
The leading dimension of the array B. LDB >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i, the i-th diagonal element of A is zero, indicating that the matrix is singular and the solutions X have not been computed.

para.pre: A check is made to verify that A is nonsingular.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DTBTRS.

summary.para: Computes the Cholesky factorization of a real symmetric positive definite band matrix A.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': Upper triangle of A is stored; = 'L': Lower triangle of A is stored.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: kd
param.pre: The number of superdiagonals of the matrix A if UPLO = 'U', or the number of subdiagonals if UPLO = 'L'. KD >= 0.

param.name: ab
param.pre: Dimension (LDAB,N) On entry, the upper or lower triangle of the symmetric band matrix A, stored in the first KD+1 rows of the array. The j-th column of A is stored in the j-th column of the array AB as follows: if UPLO = 'U', AB(kd+1+i-j,j) = A(i,j) for max(1,j-kd)<=i<=j; if UPLO = 'L', AB(1+i-j,j) = A(i,j) for j<=i<=min(n,j+kd). On exit, if = 0, the triangular factor U or L from the Cholesky factorization A = UT*U or A = L*LT of the band matrix A, in the same storage format as A.
The leading dimension of the array AB. LDAB >= KD+1.

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i, the leading minor of order i is not positive definite, and the factorization could not be completed.

para.pre: The factorization has the form A = UT * U, if UPLO = 'U', or A = L * LT, if UPLO = 'L', where U is an upper triangular matrix and L is lower triangular.

The band storage scheme is illustrated by the following example, when N = 6, KD = 2, and UPLO = 'U': On entry: On exit: * * a13 a24 a35 a46 * * u13 u24 u35 u46 * a12 a23 a34 a45 a56 * u12 u23 u34 u45 u56 a11 a22 a33 a44 a55 a66 u11 u22 u33 u44 u55 u66 Similarly, if UPLO = 'L' the format of A is as follows: On entry: On exit: a11 a22 a33 a44 a55 a66 l11 l22 l33 l44 l55 l66 a21 a32 a43 a54 a65 * l21 l32 l43 l54 l65 * a31 a42 a53 a64 * * l31 l42 l53 l64 * * Array elements marked * are not used by the routine.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DPBTRF.

summary.para: Solves a system of linear equations A*X = B with a symmetric positive definite band matrix A using the Cholesky factorization A = UT*U or A = L*LT computed by DPBTRF.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': Upper triangular factor stored in AB; = 'L': Lower triangular factor stored in AB.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: kd
param.pre: The number of superdiagonals of the matrix A if UPLO = 'U', or the number of subdiagonals if UPLO = 'L'. KD >= 0.

param.name: nrhs
param.pre: The number of right hand sides, i.e., the number of columns of the matrix B. NRHS >= 0.

param.name: ab
param.pre: Dimension (LDAB,N) The triangular factor U or L from the Cholesky factorization A = UT*U or A = L*LT of the band matrix A, stored in the first KD+1 rows of the array. The j-th column of U or L is stored in the j-th column of the array AB as follows: if UPLO ='U', AB(kd+1+i-j,j) = U(i,j) for max(1,j-kd)<=i<=j; if UPLO ='L', AB(1+i-j,j) = L(i,j) for j<=i<=min(n,j+kd).
The leading dimension of the array AB. LDAB >= KD+1.

param.name: b
param.pre: Dimension (LDB,NRHS) On entry, the right hand side matrix B. On exit, the solution matrix X.
The leading dimension of the array B. LDB >= max(1,N).

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine ?PBTRS.

summary.para: Estimates the reciprocal of the condition number (in the 1-norm) of a real symmetric positive definite band matrix using the Cholesky factorization A = UT*U or A = L*LT computed by DPBTRF.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': Upper triangular factor stored in AB; = 'L': Lower triangular factor stored in AB.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: kd
param.pre: The number of superdiagonals of the matrix A if UPLO = 'U', or the number of subdiagonals if UPLO = 'L'. KD >= 0.

param.name: ab
param.pre: Dimension (LDAB,N) The triangular factor U or L from the Cholesky factorization A = UT*U or A = L*LT of the band matrix A, stored in the first KD+1 rows of the array. The j-th column of U or L is stored in the j-th column of the array AB as follows: if UPLO ='U', AB(kd+1+i-j,j) = U(i,j) for max(1,j-kd)<=i<=j; if UPLO ='L', AB(1+i-j,j) = L(i,j) for j<=i<=min(n,j+kd).
The leading dimension of the array AB. LDAB >= KD+1.

param.name: aNorm
param.pre: The 1-norm (or infinity-norm) of the symmetric band matrix A.

param.name: rcond
param.pre: The reciprocal of the condition number of the matrix A, computed as RCOND = 1/(ANORM * AINVNM), where AINVNM is an estimate of the 1-norm of inv(A) computed in this routine.

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value

para.pre: An estimate is obtained for norm(inv(A)), and the reciprocal of the condition number is computed as RCOND = 1 / (ANORM * norm(inv(A))).

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DPBCON.

summary.para: Computes all eigenvalues and, optionally, eigenvectors of a real symmetric matrix A.

param.name: jobz
param.pre: = 'N': Compute eigenvalues only; = 'V': Compute eigenvalues and eigenvectors.

param.name: storedTriangle
param.pre: = 'U': Upper triangle of A is stored; = 'L': Lower triangle of A is stored.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA, N) On entry, the symmetric matrix A. If UPLO = 'U', the leading N-by-N upper triangular part of A contains the upper triangular part of the matrix A. If UPLO = 'L', the leading N-by-N lower triangular part of A contains the lower triangular part of the matrix A. On exit, if JOBZ = 'V', then if = 0, A contains the orthonormal eigenvectors of the matrix A. If JOBZ = 'N', then on exit the lower triangle (if UPLO='L') or the upper triangle (if UPLO='U') of A, including the diagonal, is destroyed.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: w
param.pre: Dimension (N) If = 0, the eigenvalues in ascending order.

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value > 0: if = i and JOBZ = 'N', then the algorithm failed to converge; i off-diagonal elements of an intermediate tridiagonal form did not converge to zero; if = i and JOBZ = 'V', then the algorithm failed to compute an eigenvalue while working on the sub-matrix lying in rows and columns /(N+1) through mod(,N+1).

para.pre: If eigenvectors are desired, it uses a divide and conquer algorithm. The divide and conquer algorithm makes very mild assumptions about floating point arithmetic. It will work on machines with a guard digit in add/subtract, or on those binary machines without guard digits which subtract like the Cray X-MP, Cray Y-MP, Cray C-90, or Cray-2. It could conceivably fail on hexadecimal or decimal machines without guard digits, but we know of none. Because of large use of BLAS of level 3, DSYEVD needs N**2 more workspace than DSYEVX.

remarks.para:
Jeff Rutter, Computer Science Division, University of California at Berkeley, USA 
 Modified by Francoise Tisseur, University of Tennessee 
 Modified description of . Sven, 16 Feb 05.
This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine DSYEVD.

summary.para: Computes for an N-by-N real non-symmetric matrix A, the eigenvalues and, optionally, the left and/or right eigenvectors.

param.name: jobvl
param.pre: = 'N': left eigenvectors of A are not computed; = 'V': left eigenvectors of A are computed.

param.name: jobvr
param.pre: = 'N': right eigenvectors of A are not computed; = 'V': right eigenvectors of A are computed.

param.name: n
param.pre: The order of the matrix A. N >= 0.

param.name: a
param.pre: Dimension (LDA,N) On entry, the N-by-N matrix A. On exit, A has been overwritten.
The leading dimension of the array A. LDA >= max(1,N).

param.name: wr
param.pre: Dimension (N)

param.name: wi
param.pre: Dimension (N) WR and WI contain the real and imaginary parts, respectively, of the computed eigenvalues. Complex conjugate pairs of eigenvalues appear consecutively with the eigenvalue having the positive imaginary part first.

param.name: vl
param.pre: Dimension (LDVL,N) If JOBVL = 'V', the left eigenvectors u(j) are stored one after another in the columns of VL, in the same order as their eigenvalues. If JOBVL = 'N', VL is not referenced. If the j-th eigenvalue is real, then u(j) = VL(:,j), the j-th column of VL. If the j-th and (j+1)-st eigenvalues form a complex conjugate pair, then u(j) = VL(:,j) + i*VL(:,j+1) and u(j+1) = VL(:,j) - i*VL(:,j+1).
The leading dimension of the array VL. LDVL >= 1; if JOBVL = 'V', LDVL >= N.

param.name: vr
param.pre: Dimension (LDVR,N) If JOBVR = 'V', the right eigenvectors v(j) are stored one after another in the columns of VR, in the same order as their eigenvalues. If JOBVR = 'N', VR is not referenced. If the j-th eigenvalue is real, then v(j) = VR(:,j), the j-th column of VR. If the j-th and (j+1)-st eigenvalues form a complex conjugate pair, then v(j) = VR(:,j) + i*VR(:,j+1) and v(j+1) = VR(:,j) - i*VR(:,j+1).
The leading dimension of the array VR. LDVR >= 1; if JOBVR = 'V', LDVR >= N.

param.name: info
param.pre: is INTEGER = 0: successful exit < 0: if = -i, the i-th argument had an illegal value. > 0: if = i, the QR algorithm failed to compute all the eigenvalues, and no eigenvectors have been computed; elements i+1:N of WR and WI contain eigenvalues which have converged.

para.pre: The right eigenvector v(j) of A satisfies A * v(j) = lambda(j) * v(j) where lambda(j) is its eigenvalue. The left eigenvector u(j) of A satisfies u(j)**T * A = lambda(j) * u(j)**T where u(j)**T denotes the transpose of u(j). The computed eigenvectors are normalized to have Euclidean norm equal to 1 and largest component real.

remarks.para: This method corresponds to the LAPACK routine ?GEEV.

member.name: M:Extreme.Mathematics.Generic.GenericImplementations.RegisterGenericProvider(Extreme.ProviderManager)
member.summary: Registers the provider of generic implementations of linear algebra functions.

member.name: T:Extreme.Mathematics.Generic.ManagedCoreProvider`1
member.summary: Represents a managed provider for the core linear algebra and FFT functionality for an element type.

remarks.para: The classes in the namespace use the standard Basic Linear Algebra Subroutines (BLAS) whenever possible. The Extreme Optimization Mathematics Library for .NET provides two implementations. One is in 100% managed code. The other calls a native, highly optimized, processor-specific kernel.
This class exposes properties that allow you to specify the BLAS objects that are to be used by the classes in this namespace.

You can select the managed implementation by calling the method. To select the native implementation, call the method. The native kernel is used by default. This is the fastest option, especially for larger matrices, but also has a larger memory footprint.
